SEI.Class Name: Urban China: Space, Place and Urban Transformation

summary_comment: Harold's teaching style is inconsistent, starting off easy but becoming increasingly challenging and outdated. While some students find his classes and exams difficult and boring, others appreciate the labs and his helpfulness. Overall, his exams require rote memorization of his words, and his lectures are considered outdated and frustrating.

Ratings.comment: Honestly, Harold was pretty chill at first, he didn’t give any work and the class was easy. Flash forward three weeks in and I catch him spreading his gooch hairs on my exam after I handed it in, kinda weird move tbh. Overall would watch that again though highly recommend this class.
To get the best grade, be sure to regurgitate his words back to him in each assignment and test. Otherwise, its the curve for you.

His classes are boring, frustrating, and dated. It is a shame that this man is teaching classes required for many majors. A councelor told me not to include the grades recived in his class in my GPA calculation. Tip for passing exams: spew everything he told you, and mention his name.

The classes were interesting but far outdated.  He is stuck in the 70's as are his lectures.  If these classes were optional I wold have never taken them.  When in college I had a 3.7 GPA and never scored over 45% on his tests which in most cases were A's on his scale.  This class needs new blood and new information to keep students competitive.

This prof felt he was the smartest man in the department, and he very well could have been.  But he would impose his intelligence in a way that would make students feel inferior to his supreme intelligence.  The labs were worthwhile, but only because he didn't teach them.  Exams weren't that bad, but I have studied maps since high school.  He did make them rather difficult, however.

Haven't had him in years, but he needs a warning. Nice guy, but boring class and impossible exams. The key to doing well in his exams is to write down everything you can think of relating to the topic regardless if it's relevant to the question or not.
Horrible

He will crush you with painfully difficult tests and terribly boring lectures.  Don't expect to pass his exams.  Just answer a question in class once every 3 weeks and you'll be fine.  He is a helpful guy...a bit full of himself...but helpful nonetheless.
The worst teacher ever in the history of mankind. Ironic that he thinks he is the greatest.  A bitter, old man that should retire, or be forced to leave by the department.
rambles on too much,the tests are essay based and the average was like a 30.terrible teacher
It is not cool for people to get 25 out of 100 on an midterm and it is ok.  Also, if the computers weren't in front of my face I would fall asleep.

Takes simple concepts and goes round and round in circles, deeper and deeper until everyone falls asleep. Tests are all essay, and graded extremely hard. Ask questions and he likes you, though, and that helps.
No Comments
This guy would let you drown in your own spit. worst class expoerence ever.
Obviously intelligent, boring, expects encyclopedic knowledge of the material.

summary_comment: Jim is highly regarded as an excellent instructor, known for his engaging and passionate teaching style, which encourages critical thinking and independent learning. Students appreciate his helpfulness, fairness in grading, and flexibility with deadlines, though some find his exams challenging. Overall, Jim is seen as a dedicated and approachable professor who makes a significant positive impact on his students' learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Truly a great professor. I loved his class very much and he was always helpful and understanding. The information in lectures was pretty interesting and the class was the perfect level of difficulty. Not too easy but not absurdly difficult. Jim gave good feedback and graded more than fairly. I think he is retiring so I wish him the best!

Jim is a really amazing professor. His class was so engaging and he was clearly passionate about what he was teaching. I honestly looked forward to his class every week. The class is pretty discussion-based but we were all encouraged to think critically. Jim is overall an amazing guy and a really incredible instructor.

I absolutely adored this class. Professor DeGrand encouraged us to think for ourselves and challenge what we already knew. It was very clear how passionate he was about the subject material, and he is overall a great guy. He also provided a lot of flexibility when it came to things like due dates and always took students feedback into consideration

Jim was a fantastic instructor, He was always willing to help when students had technical issues. He made sure that we were well informed and prepared for lab reports and even made tutorials to explain concepts. I wish he taught more ASP courses. I would recommend him to anyone. :)

COVID made this class super easy cuz he didnt make us take any finals or midterms. I didnt read a word of the textbook. The labs are a real pain, but not unbearable. Jim is a great guy, funny and cares about teaching. Take this class if you need a lowkey and easy credit for science.

I took his biogeography class, it wasn't too difficult but I definitely had to put in a decent amount of work for an A. He class had two tests, variously weekly assignments, a major semester project, and two 3-hour homework assignments. Though his class took work, Jim is an awesome dude who's passionate about natural history.

His tests are unbelievably difficult. Some if not most of the exam material is not covered in class or in the text, it's up to you to figure out. The single most unnecessarily difficult 1000 level course I have ever taken. His lectured were unstructured and extremely difficult to follow.

Graded by easy lab assignments and 3 mid terms. Exams are easy if you read the assigned chapters and do the practice tests. Lectures can be long and somewhat boring, but this should be an easy A if you put in a little effort.

Jim is definitely a great guy that means well, however the structure of his tests are so difficult that the majority of the class gets less than a B on each one. He offers extra credit but it does not make up for the tests that are made to yield around a 70% class average

He's a genuinely funny, charming guy who is invested in your success and cares about effective teaching. He's no pushover though. You will earn every point in his courses (but he allows you to make up for mistakes by investing in extra credit, so take advantage early). Best to just go to his lectures. Don't skip, you'll save effort if you go.

He's a nice guy, but tests are very difficult. I recommend reading the book for the first midterm and pay attention to everything he says in class, He'll post the powerpoints, but the midterms will be more challenging than need be. Do EC cloud obs everyday to save your grade.

Funny and nice. Always available to help. Learned a lot. Book isn't needed, but helps if you don't understand something. Extra credit through a DAILY cloud observation on an iPhone app. Takes 2 minutes of your day, but he gives 7% added to your final grade if you do it. You'll need it, exam average was below 70%. Class might seem easy, its not.

I took his 1900 Geography class. I will avoid taking another class by him again. I attended lectures and labs and read the book and studied all the powerpoints for his exams and the class average was a C or below. Only a handful of As. And he expects this. He does not cover material in depth the way he tests you over it. Confusing language.

He knows a lot and has entertaining lectures. The labs and homework are easy, but the exams average a C- so good luck. Overall class total average is a C at end of year. I would avoid the class unless you excel at this topic. There will be roughly 10 A's at end of year out of 200 students.

I took his 5922 class as part of my Atmospheric Science major. He is extremely knowledgeable about the subject matter, but isn't always 100% clear about assignments. However, he's always very willing to answer questions and go over instructions. He's probably the most approachable instructor I've ever had, and one of the most knowledgeable.

Doesn't make expectations clear and then takes away points on assignments on things that were never even mentioned or part of any reading material. Lectures pointless but takes attendance. One of the worst organized classes I have ever had. Nice enough guy, but should not be teaching.

summary_comment: Dr. McSweeney is highly regarded for her engaging and effective teaching style, with many students praising her warmth, intelligence, and ability to make complex topics accessible. Her classes are described as both enjoyable and intellectually stimulating, with several students recommending attending office hours and lectures regularly. While some found the class easy with minimal testing, the overall consensus is that her passion for the subject matter significantly enhances the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: A very amazing class with Kendra! It's one of the two capstone classes for geography students, and I wouldn't be too worried about it. Just relax and do the work that you have to do for it, and be prepared to discuss readings in class.
Just come to class and labs

Kendra was an amazing instructor! She made sure classes were engaging, even with topics I previously was not interested in. She gave students opportunities to share their opinions and experiences with each subject, which made it more interesting. Even though it was an early lecture, I was excited to come to class throughout the entire semester!

I took a class with this professor last semester and I thought she was just OK as a professor, so I don't get where all the positive reviews are coming from, to be honest. She seemed a bit arrogant and had a very monotone voice, but other than that, the class was very easy since there was only 1 test and a final paper.
Dr. McSweeney was very smart and cared about the content she was teaching. She was very welcoming and warm to students and it was one of my favorite classes and lecturers so far!

I cant say enough good things about Dr McSweeney. Shes the best. Honestly. Go to office hours. I PROMISE you wont regret it. She genuinely cares about you and your interests. 2800 is pretty interesting, but Dr McSweeney is the star of the class. Take her classes as much as possible

Dr McSweeney is incredibly intelligent and kind. I loved taking GEOG2800 with her; her teaching is so relaxed while also effective. It is very easy to listen to her and take in the content without feeling bored. Attendance is taken every lecture, and she tests you about things not covered in the power-points, so show up! It'll be worth it.
A phenomenal individual and great class with a plethora of materials awaiting further exploration by the eager mind. If you are not an eager mind, do not waste your time and go the business school.
Very open-minded and easy going. Show up, take some notes, and pass. Brain dead course and she offers extra credit for watching a movie or seeing a speaker with a topic relevant to the course

Professor McSweeney was nice and she was clearly knowledgable about the topics. In regards to tests, she listened to students and she would use our feedback to prepare for the next test. For ex., we all hated the T/F questions so she stopped putting them on our tests! Easy gen ed course for sure, it's a 3 credit hour w/ lab! Definitely recommend.

Kendra has a reputation for being a good teacher. However, I found that she doesn't put much time or effort into teach and instead relies on her obvious charisma / likeability. She also didn't do much teaching. She largely told everyone what she wanted you to think about the topics and you were expected to agree.

I absolutely adore Kendra. She's very interesting and easy to listen to. The class is really light on course load. No exams, but two papers, a debate, and a map quiz. This is my second class with Kendra as my prof (which was done purposefully). Overall all, really easy but fun and insightful. Definitely take her class!

Dr. McSweeney is my favorite  prof at OSU! She's brilliant, engaging and will really make you think. And she's always happy to meet with students in office hours unlike some Geography profs (Malecki) who don't like to make time for us lowly undergrads...

Easier than any of my high school science classes.  She's super nice and just wants every one to get good grades.  Go to class and pay attention and you won't have any problem getting and A.  The labs are super easy also.

One of my favorite professors of all time, the class was interesting and she updates the material to reflect current events. However, one of my favorite parts was her responsiveness to students and helping us to succeed.  After the first exam, she decided to get rid of the components that caused the lowest scores for future exams. Great Class!

Dr. McSweeney is a great professor, and 2800 was not very difficult either. Her lectures are interesting, and she welcomes feedback and discussion. There was never any homework (except for two take-home labs), and the only tests were the exams.

2100 was a pretty easy course. Easy grading and clear expectations on assignments. It is easy to skate by in the class but the material is pretty interesting, too. She has field experience in the region so it makes brings the lessons to life in a cool way. She is pretty interesting to listen to. Take this for an easy and interesting GenEd credit.

Great mixture of applied work and academic articles to help you in the field.  She's approachable and frank about the material.  One of the most helpful instructors I've had. Even though the department has its ideological divides, she's an excellent bridge that helps everyone to make their own work count.
Great person, great professor.  Take every class you can with her.

Plenty of reading but that is the only hard part of Kendra's class. You get out what you put in, which is how college should be. No TESTS!!! She's really nice and knows her stuff on Latin America too. Take her class!

One of the best teachers I've had at OSU. There's a lot of reading but once you get past that and pace yourself on the project you'll do alright. She made the class really fun when it could've been excruciating by having open discussions. She really pushes you to participate and share your thoughts.
great professor. really helpful and easy to talk to.

She is a great teacher. She keeps information interesting. She will stop talking about a subject if the class doesn't find it interesting and will move on to something that people care about. There's a lot of reading, but it's worth it, take a class with her if you can, she's great.
take as many classes as you can with her, great teacher.
kendra is such a great teacher. she is hilarious and makes the class so much fun. if i had the chance, i'd take all my geography classes with her!
Prof. McSweeney was awesome, and she made the subject matter interesting.
Kendra ROCKS!
Was a decent class.  You must show up every day.  The material is so so, in that it can become dry.  But Kendra made it interesting.  She's a good teacher.
explains things pretty good, labs are easy. and if she was a mom, **** :)

I would highly recommend Kendra's class to other students because she is an excellent professor.  I learned a lot in her class, and it has proved to be very helpful in my other Geography class this quarter. It's a lot of work, but it's worth it! :)
Excellent prof! Wish I could have her for all my classes -- smart AND gorgeous!
Nice lady.  You have to work hard, but it's not too bad.  MAkes it kind of interesting.

summary_comment: Professor Barnes is an easy grader who provides fair midterms and finals, but her teaching style is largely ineffective. Students find her lectures boring and redundant, as she reads directly from posted PowerPoint slides and occasionally shows irrelevant YouTube clips. Despite being described as nice, her classes are considered unengaging and primarily useful for attending labs and completing minimal pre-study.

Ratings.comment: Grades late with no help or reasoning for given grades.

Wasted my money on the textbook, wasted my time by going to class. Just go for map quizzes and to turn in papers. Having said that, she's extremely boring and simply reads the powerpoints word for word during lecture (posted on carmen) then shows some youtube clip she thinks is relevant. Easy A

I bought the book but wasted my money. The powerpoints are all that matter and are posted online. She just reads word for word off the powerpoint so it's really boring, but she's really nice and the class is super easy if you just attend the labs and do some basic studying before the tests.

Fairly simple class. Professor Barnes is a horrible instructor though. Very unprepared for class. Extremely dry and boring. Don't try to take notes by pen and paper...you better have a laptop so you can type because she goes too fast. Mid term and final are graded fairly i would say. I wouldn't recommend this class to anyone.

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded, with some students finding the lab portion particularly helpful and enjoying the subject matter. However, others criticize the lack of structure and clear guidance, citing issues with test preparation and the instructor's handling of student questions. While some highly recommend the class, others warn against it due to its disorganized nature and unclear communication.

Ratings.comment: Lacked a bit of structure to the class and felt underprepared for the tests, however, the lab portion strongly made up for it. TA kind of made the class, but the class itself is really easy so I can't complain much. I enjoyed the subject material and conversations, though she was a bit hard to understand. Overall would take again.

Honestly a great professor all around. I took a class with a very few number of students and was initially scared about how the class would turn out. But honestly it could not have been better. The prof helped answer all questions and was available to students whenever needed while also being flexible. Highly recommend taking a class with her.

Yue puts a lot of energy into this class and although she is new to teaching, she is working hard to involve the students in discussion and create engaging lectures. To be fair, it is challenging to pay attention and participate, but there is not too much work outside of class. She is also very resourceful and great at answering questions.

Class was not structured. Instructor would hijack presentations on a near weekly basis (2 classes/wk). Class was monotonous, title was Topics in GIS but the only things we ever discussed was climate change and fossil fuels. Instructor would become visibly disgruntled if class wasnt already familiar with arbitrary acronyms or chemical processes.

No guidelines, grades, benchmarks, or general information usually ever (sometimes after serious probing and several different versions). Didn't handle students not understanding material (has laughed in faces) So much information and no idea how to structure it, connect topics, summarize, or otherwise make the information seem useful. DON'T TAKE!

summary_comment: Dr. Root is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for ensuring her students grasp key concepts through engaging classes and challenging yet manageable labs. While exams can be demanding, students find her approach effective and her overall teaching quality outstanding. She is consistently praised as one of the best geology professors at OSU.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Root is an amazing professor! I enjoyed every moment in her class. You need to attend class to pass, but she makes sure that her students understand the concepts in the class. The labs require you to think on your own, but they are pretty easy. Exams are sort of difficult but not insane. She is hands down one of the best geog profs at OSU

SEI.Subject: PUBHHBP
SEI.Class Name: Second Year Doctoral Seminar in HBHP

SEI.Subject: PUBHHBP
SEI.Class Name: Second Year Doctoral Seminar in HBHP

summary_comment: Dr. Munroe is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and genuine care for her students. Her classes are well-organized, with meaningful group work and a mix of individual assignments, and she provides ample feedback. Students find her classes engaging and relevant to real-life situations, with a focus on discussions and writing assignments rather than traditional testing.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Munroe obviously cares about students. The readings were well organized into modules, the group work was meaningful, but there were individual assignments as well. I learned a great deal from this class

Dr. Munroe is fun and explains the material clearly. The class was easy and very relevant to real life. The midterms were worth 24% of the grade, but if you show up to class they are easy to do well on.

This lady is a gem. She is super helpful even when you don't ask for her feedback. There were no tests in this class but several short essays (1-2 pages) and then an extended essay as a final (750-1000 words). I would take a class with her as the professor in no time. Though I'm still not 100% on what a geographer is.

LOVED Munroe's class! Attendance is important but missing a few classes won't kill your grade. No book- readings online. Blog post weekly (paragraph) and readings are maximum 8 pages.  Her class was interesting and I felt like I was learning relevant information about the world.  Fun class! Highly recommend!

We only had 1 quiz all semester. Most of the grade came from in class assignments which were easy to get an A on. Other than an annotated bibliography, we had one 5 page paper due at the end of the semester. Not very clear on notes, but you dont need them to get an A. She's a nice person so dont be afraid to ask questions.

Absolutely loved Professor Munroe! My class was my only morning lecture but still attended. Class was relevant to real life and no book was required. She always yielded time for discussion and always gave feedback. Has a very quirky but down to earth personality and wish I had her as a fun aunt or something! If you need a GE filled take Geog 2400!

She only takes attendance someone days and she usually lets you know when she will. No text book was required. She is a little boring but her class is well organized. Probably a group exercise once a week. No tests just papers, no hard at all. Easy A class.

Darla really loves her job and it is easy to get an A. If you show up to class and engage in the conversations you'll be fine. The HW assignments seem hard but she grades easy. She is just looking for you to learn something and once she sees that you have she will give you that A that you want.

This class is fairly easy as long as you go to lecture, pay attention, and do the in-class writings. Midterms and finals are written but aren't terribly difficult as you are given three prompts and get to chose which two you want to respond to. Overall, this class was very interesting and not too difficult as long as you give a reasonable effort.

This class is generally an easy A. She gives in class writing assignments so attendance is mandatory. Her tests are written out, but the average is usually a mid to high B. She offers extra credit that can raise your final grade up to 5%. Overall easy and very interesting class. You jump from one topic to another so just pay attention and your set

You'll write three papers for her class and the exam and midterm are both written, so keep that in mind.  Her class is pretty straight forward. You need to go to class to get a reasonable understanding of the material; reading the course pack alone won't cut it.

Attendance isn't mandatory, but it basically necessary to pass the exams. Their are three essays which all are easy, but graded pretty tough. Her notes are scattered, but still SLIGHTY comprehensive. Definitely not an "easy-A" class, covers alot of material, and you learn alot. Exams tough, ALOT of studying neccessary.
not necessary to go to class and made exams and papers real easy

Definitely take this class.  I had it for a GEC.  5 pt quizzes online over reading, you get 2 hours for the 10 questions. exams were super easy.  gave us a choice of 5 out of the 10 definitions, 2 of 3 short essay and 1 of 2 long essay. you need to go to class to get the right definitions and examples to do  really well

Class was alright. Lectures could be entertaining. I thought the first part of the class was far more entertaining than the 2nd part. There is a decent curve on both tests and lots of extra credit. Average grade in class was an 84%
Class subject was very abstract and theoretical. When asked a question she goes on 10 min long rants that leave you even more confused.
This class wasn't what I expected, but in the end I learned a lot from it.  Good GIS class.  Lots of powerpoint, but it's hard to keep theory lively.
No Comments

This class was crap.  The readings were ok but all she did was teach from the book.  I would recommend never going, but she requires attendance.  The assignments were total busy work and were just ridiculous.  Had it not been required, I never would have taken it!
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Parece is perceived as ineffective and unengaged, with many students finding her class overly demanding and poorly structured. Students report unclear instructions, unreasonable workload, and a lack of supportive resources. While some appreciate her availability during office hours and find the class manageable with self-study, the overall consensus is that the course is poorly designed and lacks clear guidance.

Ratings.comment: Professor Parece actually has no idea what it's like to be a student in her class. My experience has been upsetting to say the least. Actual absurd amounts of work for a class I'm never going to use, and directions that lack actual helpful and useful directions. I respect professors that want their students to learn, but I feel she doesn't care.

Professor Parece's teaching is ineffective and inconsiderate. She fails to explain concepts clearly in lab directions, leaving students confused and frustrated. Her workload is unreasonable, especially for those taking this class as a requirement. Instead of making the material accessible, she makes the course far more difficult than necessary.

Overall I would say this class went pretty well. For being an intro class for using GIS it was pretty friendly to those without experience on it. Tests were based on lectures and there weren't any textbooks required. Although it could be hard to grasp some of the concepts taught, Dr Parece had quite a few office hours to attend to answer questions.
this class will have you tearing your eyes out with frustration, sooo sooo poorly managed and designed

As long you come into the class knowing that you will learn everything on your own you will do fine. Her lectures are bad and she is very hands off. The textbook sucks and is super expensive. Also you will have to read literally every page of it. However, she is approachable in office hours and over email, and is responsive when prompted

200 dollar(not kidding)required textbook that is vague and outdated (she has "updated" it by writing in edits with mismatched page numbers on carmen). This class desperately needs a TA and dozens of office hours a week. Just very poorly designed class, she seems nice, but you will literally flounder for hours just trying to get ArcGIS to run

When dealing with a complex program like GIS, nothing says "I could care less" like 1 class a week, years old prerecorded lectures, and a hands-off "figure it out" approach where your only true mechanism of consistent help is to keep hounding T.A's or posting in a discussion Q&A and awaiting a response. Lame, lazy, and a class that truly sucked.

Aside from the non-mandatory 8AM lectures, I enjoyed this intro course to map design and GIS. Labs were all useful and applicable, especially once you got to choose your own topics instead of following step-by-step directions. She is a passionate and enthusiastic professor who is ready to help whoever asks for it. TAs are helpful as well.

Dr. Parece is clearly passionate and enthusiastic about GIS. This comes across in her videos. TAs were helpful when need be, but the lab book we worked out of was clear enough that I never really needed to go in person to the labs. Pretty much everyone who takes the course is required to take it for a major/minor, and the class is good enough.
Good lectures, communicates information clearly

Dr Parece seems nice and knowledgeable, but I just didn't gain anything from the class. Her prerecorded lectures were all just her reading off the slides, and then the weekly quizzes would involve questions that were never mentioned. The labs all came from a textbook/workbook that was poorly written, and difficult to follow. Had to teach myself.

Even though this was an intro class, Dr. Parece brought so much enthusiasm to her lectures. You can tell she really likes to teach, and she is very knowledgeable as well. She is very willing to help students, and responds quickly to emails. Deadlines for labs were very manageable. Labs are pretty straightforward, exams are a breeze if you study.
Half-semester long class, very easy and fun. I enjoyed having Professor Parece and her lectures are fairly entertaining.
Dr. Parece has a good layout for GEOG 2200 that makes the class easy to follow. It was well structured and never too much work at once.

A good intro mapping class that fulfills data analysis GE. Professor is new but very kind and knowledgable on the programming you use for assignments. Homework is more or less weekly, a mapping assignment that guides you through the steps and you write a report at the end. Final project, no exams.

summary_comment: Professor Ettlinger is widely regarded as having a poor teaching quality, with students finding her lectures monotonous and the material difficult to understand. Assignments are often vague and require substantial effort, while grading is harsh, leading to low class averages. Students generally advise against taking her class due to its challenging nature and subjective grading criteria.

Ratings.comment: She's lecture is so boring. The readings she assigned each week were very difficult to understand and took too much time. You need to write an essay every week, and the word requirement for the paper goes from 500 words to vague (you need to write more to get points). The grading of essays is very harsh and the class average is very low.

Professor Ettlinger is one of the most inconsistent graders I've had. She does give a lot of feedback, but often if she doesn't like the comparison you are trying to give she will take points off. Homework is for completion and you will be graded on papers and projects that follow the backward grading strategy listed above. Would NOT recommend her.

I've never had a professor give more vague assignments and then grade so harshly, it's like she assumed we could all read her mind. Her class was repetitive, called for about 80-100 pages of reading a week, and was overall confusing. I'd highly recommend skipping this one.

Basically, you go in and the first day she'll tell you READ! And you will pass, but show up to lecture.... lecture was literally the most boring thing ever shes just goes on and on and doesnt stop. She will volunteer people to speak and then counter what they say in every way possible then continues on to the next thing. Lecture was a waste of time
Long lectures, boring subject matter, but she's very passionate about it. Grade determined by midterms and final.

Grade based off 2 Carmen posts (guaranteed A if you just do it&make it relevant, super easy) &2 exams--not hard, very fair. Hands out very helpful outlines--study those. ATTENDANCE IS IMPORTANT can potentially bump your end of semester grade up. Extra credit available, extensive reading assignments--didn't do them, just took notes in lecture

Very. Very. Boring. Assigns unreasonable academic essays for readings. Tests are over class outlines. In the middle of the semester, she passed out handouts for her students to give her recommendations. I recommended that she shorten the readings and make the class less political. Regarding the readings, her response was and I quote: "Get over it."

Lots of reading. Im only here to tell you that you cannot pass her class unless you agree with her solutions to social issues (bernie). You must be an indoctrinated socialist leftist to move on. Do you think capitalism is a good idea? Do you think people are personally responsible? Well, get ready to fail. You have to agree with her to pass.

Lectures are neither boring nor interesting, varies with the material being discussed and one's interest. The first exam is very fair, outlines given in class should be highly beneficial and mostly all that one needs for the exam. The second exam is similar except the material is not covered as well in the outlines and more difficult to study for.

You have to read around 30-50 pages worth of material each week. She also only focuses on the geography part of the subject, criticizing economics all the time. Her class is extremely boring and she grades very harshly.

Professor Ettlinger was a terrible professor. Says the class was not about memorization, but her exams were almost exactly that. The readings were unrealistically long and she expected you to fully understand the 50 page article and be able to discuss it in class. Exams were absolutely impossible. Avoid at all costs.

Worst class I've taken. Be prepared to read unreasonable amounts of reading each week. DO NOT TAKE HER. Nothing about it is enjoyable. And if you don't have prior knowledge of material you are completely left behind. Her lectures are just her talking. She skips around a lot so it's impossible to take notes. Please stay away from her if you can.

I have taken three classes with Nancy and she is wonderful. She has high expectations--- you will read and write ALOT, but you will be challenged, develop strong critical thinking skills, and come away with a thorough understanding of debates in the discipline. Plus she is always in her office and willing to help students in anyway possible

Be prepared to work. This course was challenging (probably the most difficult I have had at OSU) but also extremely rewarding. She does have high expectations for knowledge coming into the class, and there are usually 50ish pages of fairly difficult journal articles per class. If you go to her office hours she is very helpful.

she says this class assumes you have no pre-reqs. she's wrong. if she's teaching this class then you need an extensive background in a lot of social theory and feminism or you're going to be lost. The exam essays also have unreasonable expectations and are too long-she apparently forgets that students take more than one class. stay away.
Professor Ettlinger is very patient and loving, which reminds me of my own mother. I like her. And the course is interesting if you are interested in economics.

This is the worst class I have ever taken at Ohio State. The material is awfully dry, and I could barely keep my eyes open during her lecture. She just talks the whole time about her opinions. Beware!!!

Dr. Ettlinger is a brilliant professor. Smart, insightful, opinionated (but not in an overbearing way). Participate in class discussions and pay attention to the videos shown in class and you will do fine. The material can be challenging at times, but if you show up, pay attention and have decent critical thinking skills you will do fine.

Dr. Ettlinger is very much willing to help understand, she goes over things however many times it takes to get the point across. She assigned a book that really is very neutral and when she lectures she chooses to omit the parts that dont agree with her. During in class discussion I would swear I had read different books and seen different movies
This class is so boring I wanted to cry. Bring a book or laptop or something to do. Assigns long, boring readings over obscure things. Tests draw heavily on the readings.

She tries to liven up the class with her opinions on things, which can be great sometimes and not so great at other times, but either way it is better then falling asleep. We seemed to watch a lot of movies. There were quite a few articles but not as much reading as I've done in other Geog. classes. Tests are easy. Show up you'll do well.
She assigns an unreasonable amount of reading.  The class is interesting at times.
No Comments

She was very willing to help me work around a personal situation, and we discussed a great deal of subject matter out of class.  The damn readings were a pain!  She should hire a student to type them out instead of using photocopied articles.  Nancy, build a website!
this was one of the best class that I took. Nancy is brilliant. The readings are great and the teacher leads the discussions very well. Keep it up!

One should rename this class "Nancy's Tirade on Capitalism".  She would give you two opposing articles than absolutely trash the one that believed in Western Economics.  There was no scientific data to back her ranting.  I learned NOTHING except for her opinion.  At one point she blamed those who looked like me (blonde) for terrorism.
Unless you want to work really hard and learn a ton, don't take this class.
No Comments

Course load is pretty substantial, and lectures/discussions can be hard to follow, but she's always willing to listen & actually likes it when you disagree with her. Exams are awful, though--take-home essays that demand 10+ pages per question.

SEI.Subject: GEOG
SEI.Class Name: Data Justice and the Right to the Smart City

SEI.Subject: GEOG
SEI.Class Name: Data Justice and the Right to the Smart City

summary_comment: Dr. Lin is known for delivering an easy class with generous grading, making it a good choice for students seeking easy grades. However, lectures can be dry and difficult to follow, potentially boring students despite the interesting material. Students generally find him approachable and helpful, though some struggle with his teaching style, particularly early in the morning.

Ratings.comment: The class itself is incredibly easy but the lectures are really dry. While this class is not hard and and easy class in your schedule, it may bore you in the process.

If you want to learn climatology, it's better not to take this class when taught by Dr. Lin. Assignments and midterms are so easy that you will feel like a child and might loose interest in this class. Recommended if you need easy grades.
Extremely nice guy and really easy to get an A in this class. Also, pretty interesting material even if you're not into science. I would recommend this class.

I enjoyed him and his class. He is very generous with his grading, and is organized. It can be difficult to understand him at times, but I never had much trouble with that. You can tell he enjoys teaching and helping the students. He has great advice on how to develop in-class presentations.
Definitely take this class if you can. Although the material can get technical, Dr J is a nice guy and a lenient grader (lowest midterm is dropped).

This is the easiest class ever. When there are "pop" quizzes, he basically goes over the material. He let us drop one of everything, so if you do well on the first two midterms (all multiple choice), you don't have to take a final. We watched a lot of movies too which helped kill time and was a break from powerpoint slides

He was always nice and seemed interested in what he was teaching, but it was incredibly difficult to understand him...especially at 8:30 in the morning. Good intentions, but difficult to learn from if you need things explained out for you.

summary_comment: Professor Harvey is highly knowledgeable and passionate about transport security, evident from his detailed and insightful lectures. While his teaching style can be dry at times, he is responsive and genuinely cares about the subject matter. Students appreciate his efforts to provide a social perspective in a technical field, though they suggest improvements in grading and more interactive assignments. Overall, Harvey is respected for his expertise and the valuable insights he provides.

Ratings.comment:
Quick responses via email and canvas. He is obsessive about his subject which is good yet his delivery method needs some help. I would have liked to see easier grading on such a niche topic when it came to homework and perhaps a few more of those assignments. 
This class requires you to proofread your work and study the lecture slides.

Harv is a good dude. Transport security is a pretty niche subject but he gave some absolutely great lectures - not super engaging but good - and showed he cared about the subject. Class was easy with not too much effort needed except for the final paper. Rumor has it u get extra credit if u wear a bike helmet to class and talk abt sustainability

Harvey is the best at what he does. Adds a social perspective to an otherwise highly technical field of work. First impression was that he was a bit smug/arrogant, but he's clever and generally friendly if you get him talking about bikes. 5301 was a fantastic class, learned so much and changed my perspective on a lot of things. Would take again.

summary_comment: Mat Coleman is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics accessible and enjoyable. Students praise his knowledge and passion for the subject, noting that while the course demands effort, it is rewarding. Coleman's classes are challenging but fair, with a mix of lectures, readings, and assignments that transform students' perspectives on the material.

Ratings.comment: Mat is funny, engaging, witty, down to earth, and interesting prof. I had a great time in the lectures. The papers are graded by the TA, so I don't think the tough grading is his work. There are a lot of readings, but they aren't overwhelming.

The best professor I have had at OSU, take his class! The courseload is not overwhelming, graded with a midterm paper, final paper, 2 analysis papers, and participation. These assignments are graded tough but fair. He is funny, great at teaching, and incredibly knowledgable in the field. This course has transformed how I look at the world. Take it!

I feel like I really learned so much. I absolutely loved the class and found the lectures so interesting. Professor Coleman really cares about making the learning experience fun but also very informative. I would definitely take him again if I had to. He really makes you work hard, but you will see it all pay off by the end of the semester.

Go to class! Not only is attendance mandatory, the material literally won't make sense otherwise. Great course, really broke down tough concepts in an accessible way. Will definitely take another class with him! (also you might leave with a teeny crush on Coleman)

Wonderful professor, I always looked forward to going to class. Very passionate in how he delivers information through lectures, as well as comical. Graded on a midterm, final, 3 surprise quizzes, and attendance. As long as you are interested in learning the material, read notes before each class to prepare for quizzes, you will pass with an A.

Hands down one of the most intellectually distinguished professors in the department. He really knows what he's talking about, and wants to communicate useful information about the real world. He's very frank and efficient with his pedagogy. Truly a lot to learn from him, and even though he can be a hardass sometimes, he's invested in your success.

Matt Coleman is one of the best professors with power point at OSU. He gives engaging lectures about complex topics, which his slides summarize very well. It was a very enjoyable semester taking his class.

Lectures are amazing and the only way you'll pass the class. That being said you will have to be somewhat interested in the material to do well in the class otherwise you'll fall asleep on some of this stuff.

Coleman may be the best professor I've had at OSU. It does take genuine intellectual curiosity to excel in his classes though. His classes are not typical academic experiences, so only take him if you want to challenge yourself, have an open mind and are willing to develop a new way of thinking. If so you'll have a great experience with Dr. Coleman

I loved this class and I've learned more in this one class than any others. I love his style of lecturing. I looked forward to this class every week and was able to take my knowledge outside of class. A bit difficult with just 100 points total, but totally worth it, and 100% possible to get an A because it's so interesting and easy to pay attention

Some students enjoy him and some do not. He is fully a scholar so get ready for a lot of ranting about his views, which he will shove down your throat. He's nice and willing to help, but be prepared to be confused. Answer very specific on tests because he is very picky. If you have conservative views get ready to be pulled at like always at OSU.

He takes himself way too seriously. 3701 is a required class for a lot of international studies specializations, but he wanted to teach the class like we were all senior geography majors. He acts like all of the topics he teaches are the monumental features of intellectualism and makes whatever his main points are inaccessible.

The track I was following involved cities and transportation geography, so, the course "Making of the Modern World" made me assume that this would be about the building of major cities around the world. WOW was I wrong. He makes his political leanings very evident in class which is very uncomfortable. Only 100 pts make up the class. STAY AWAY

I took this class as a GE and I made a mistake. People on this site rated him well, but I don't see any of it. Lectures are incredibly boring and tests and papers are super ambiguous. Avoid it if you can.

Don't take this class it's one of the hardest classes I've taken for it only to be a ge course. I should've taken this class at the community college would've been way easier. He takes Attendance everyday and it's apart of your grade. Exams are brutal you have to write  10 sentences on a topic for 4 topics HE chooses. Save yourself the time and RUN
He is a nice guy but this course might be a little bit difficult as a GE lecture
He is my favorite professor of all time.  He is extremely knowledgeable and passionate, and he makes complex concepts digestible.  I would recommend any student to take at least one of his courses.

The and the class were good. He's good an engaging students in the lectures. He often goes and tangents but they tend to be comical or about current events. There are pop quizzes but with mandatory attendance, you'll be fine, it's just a check to make sure you're paying attention.

Dr. Coleman is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. This is the second class I've taken with him and wouldn't be opposed to taking more with him in the future. He is one of the most down-to-earth guys I've ever met. I highly recommend taking one of his classes, you'll learn a lot of important things about the world we live in.

Best professor I've had at Ohio State, no doubt about it. Somehow, at age 40-something he manages to be cooler than most of the students he teaches. You'll be amazed by how cool political geography is-- and what with Dr. Coleman's post-Marxist/poststructuralist tendencies, if you take his class you're sure to be enthralled indeed.

If you don't quite /get/ the content it may be difficult - very conceptual, but I took to it fairly easily so I can't speak much to the difficulty there. Will say that it was an amazing class. Eye-opening, very different approach from what I've ever studied before - political geography is incredibly cool, and Dr. Coleman is the absolute cooooolest.

Coleman knows what he's talking about more than anyone I've had so far. He's genuinely passionate about what he teaches, and also makes the lectures fun and interesting. One of the best professors in the Geography department, if not Ohio State.

The class is so easy. Even if you study right before the day of 2 midterms and the finals, with 2-3 hours you can get A- easily. (I got 92% on both midterms, for the finals maybe around 98%-100%)There is 1 group project but very easy. Does give 2% extra credit. Grading is extremely easy. Take the class for an easy A gened. Textbook is never needed.

Coleman is a really good professor. His lectures are long and you actually have to listen to him to get the information but his tests are super easy if you review. His office door is always open and he's super helpful if you go to him. He does assign projects but they're easy to do and he'll guide you if you need it. I'm taking another class!
He was a cool guy that talks alot during lectures. Two tests, two projects, and final, and attendance is 20% easy. Tests are not hard. Projects are little bit tricky.

Without a doubt best professor I had in 4 years. This class should be mandatory for all US citizens. It was a very hard class, but Matt is the man. Extremely helpful and a wonderful teacher. Guy even helped me write my masters entrance essay. Take any class you can with this guy, HE IS ONE OF THE GOOD ONES!
Mat is incredibly knowledgeable and his passion for teaching and the discipline definitely shows. He is challenging but his courses are incredibly rewarding

Dr Coleman is AMAZING! The readings were difficult but explains topics so clearly. Discussions were great, grading was fair and very flexible. Also, to agree with the previous comments, he is gorgeous.

Phenomenal professor. He's extremely passionate, organized, funny, and explains complex issues very clearly. His lectures are always thought-provoking and he's super helpful outside of class, too. Must pay attention in class to get an A, but he's a fair grader and there's not a ton of extra work. And, he's really handsome, which is an added bonus.

Other than the fact that he is from up above (canada) he is totally hott!!! The earring helps alot!! And he wears a sports coat, what more should I say, he is very helpful and his study guides help quite a bit, and he is friendly and smoking hottt!!

I really enjoyed this class when I took it, so much that I used some of his info in a paper that I wrote for another course. He was fine with it at the time, but when I asked permission to use the info in my published paper, he shot back a really nasty e-mail. Maybe he had some personal issues over the summer or something.
Easy Class. I feel if there was a different TA, the exams would have been graded a little bit more stringently. Review sheet covers everything you need (and more)

Coleman is a great teacher.  He know his stuff and is interesting.  I disagreed with some of his political ideas, but if you can back up your case he will listen and not grade you down.  Recommend him to anyone.

Great Professor would recommend taking this class with professor Coleman for the GEC.  Very interesting and without a doubt the most intelligent professors I have encountered here at OSU. The best part is his intelligence doesn't hinder his ability to teach.  He does a great job of teaching without overteaching to a class of undergraduates.

Coleman is one of the most intelligent, organized, knowledgeable, engaging teachers I have ever experienced in my life.  He makes his students think practically and intellectually while engaging the subject thoroughly.  His class made me a better student, and pushed me towards a higher level of academic excellence than I had ever experienced.
Very willing to help outside of class. Lectures are interesting and well prepared.  Earned A with a lot of work. Great class!
awesome!  Great lectures, hard concepts, would not have taken the class with anyone else!  Earned and A with a lot of work, well worth it!
Great teacher, never really liked teachers and class until I had class with him
Absolutely wonderful teacher - personable, very well organized, and he makes the class interesting.

Very straight forward and fair. Readings have been reduced to a minimum. Attend every class and read everything assigned and it is easy to do very well. No trick questions on the tests. Very committed to teaching and his students. Great attitude and humor. Always made lectures interesting.
Willing to help out!

Do all the reading, attend every lecture. You can easily get an A if you put in the effort. Tests aren't obscure at all and he's definitely a fair grader. Very little reading. Coleman's a good guy and consciously tries to involve the class; you can tell he cares about geog. I would definitely take a class from him again.

I don't know what people are complaining about... the class wasn't easy, but it's a 400-level class! You have to read a lot and don't skip classes, but Prof. Coleman was very helpful and brought up some really interesting topics. People who struggled just didn't want to put in the work.
Not a good teacher at all. work load was quite hard and expected a lot from his students.
Hard work load, expected grad level work for an undergrad class.

He's a really cool dude, and obviously knows his stuff. The only trouble he runs into sometimes is thinking that all of his students understand grad-level concepts. But that doesn't happen very often, and if a student doesn't understand something he's always willing to help out. It's a tough class, but Mr. Coleman will give everybody a fair shake.

SEI.Class Name: The Making of the Modern World

SEI.Class Name: The Making of the Modern World
