SEI.Class Name: The Making of the Modern World

summary_comment: Dr. Chan is an exceptional professor, delivering engaging and well-organized lectures in his basic meteorology course despite the challenging mathematical content. He provides comprehensive summary sheets for exams and homework, allows open notes during assessments, and even encourages the use of AI. His office hours are particularly valuable, offering extensive support to students.

Ratings.comment: Dr.Chan is an AMAZING professor! His basic meteorology course was very interesting and well taught even with all of the math. He gave a nice and organized summary sheet for everyone to use on exams and homework and also allowed open notes on all exams and even encouraged the use of AI during exams. His office hours are extremely helpful as well.

summary_comment: The professor offers an easy class with minimal weekly assignments and a final project, contributing to a manageable workload. However, the professor and TAs are notoriously unresponsive to emails, and student inquiries posted in the discussion forum often go unanswered, making it challenging to seek help or clarification.

Ratings.comment: Class is easy, each week there are a couple assignments/quizzes that make up 6% of your grade and a final assignment worth 13%. Class may be easy but good luck if you ever have an issue or need to contact the professor or ta. They never respond quick to email and there's a discussion post for students to ask questions that have never been answered.

summary_comment: Professor Chabot is generally viewed as a dedicated and kind instructor who offers valuable support to students facing difficulties. However, her lectures can be monotonous and difficult to stay engaged with unless one has an interest in human geography. Students find her assessments manageable if they put in the necessary effort, though some criticize the requirement to take tests at a separate testing center.

Ratings.comment: her lecture always makes students sleepy, and it's boring if you are not interested in human geography. But there are only 8 map quiz, 4 exams, and no finals. You'll get a good score if you try to memorize the worksheet. Maybe it's a little bit difficult for GE, but it's interesting for me to know some human geography all over the world.

The most boring class ever. She talks about 1 slide for 30 minutes. Half the class doesn't even show up. Then she expects you to know SO MUCH for the tests that are taken at the testing center. She doesn't realize this is just a GE for everyone.
Not good
She forces you to go to the stupid testing center instead of taking exams in classes.
Terrible professor, boring class.
Thank you.
Good professor,
Porfessor Chabot is a great and kind person. When I encounter difficulties she was always willing to help me. She is also a great teacher, if you do the work you will have no problem.
The class was way too difficult. You are expected to remember everything she said during lecture. Tests and quizzes are taken in the testing center. I worked pretty hard and only earned a C+

Cindy Chabot has been my professor for 3 different geography courses, and she's definitely my favorite. She is very kind and is quick and generous with grades. Many comments on here appear to be students who may have blown off the class or not been interested in geography. If you are serious about college, she's a great professor.

She's an amazing lecturer. The course is very interesting and she adds some anecdotes that can help connect to the material. The grade is based on 4 exams and some map quizzes. I never bought the textbook, which you can get by on doing only if you attend every class and take notes on the lecture.
Most boring lectures I've ever had to sit through....

The class had four exams consisting of mc's, short answer, extended response and extra credit. She gives questions to do as you read through the textbook and an extensive study guide that makes the exams easy. Don't take if you frequently skip class & don't read textbooks. She is a perfectly fair grader and is always willing to help.

A lot of people rate her badly, but I really enjoyed her class. There is a lot of info to know for exams, but she gives very clear study questions and all the essay and short answers are taken from those. She also tells you exactly what you need to read. She's really nice, too. If you take notes in class and do the study guides, you will do well.

Expects ENTIRELY too much. Exams consists of several mc, short answers, and 4 essays. She expects you to know every minute detail. And there are 4 exams throughout the semester. Way too much for a class many take as a GEC.

Most terrible professor I have ever had. She puts WAY too much information the the exams, be prepared to know information on hundreds of countries from the 1400's until present. IF YOU CAN GET DROP THE CLASS, DO IT!!!!!! I promise you will regret taking this!

she is the most boring teacher ive ever had. She literally will spend 30 minutes on a single slide just rambling about nonsense. The study guides are literally 300 questions for each test basically asking a question for every page of each chapter. IF YOU THINK THIS IS ACTUALLY GEOGRAPHY YOUR WRONG! Only extra credit if geography, rest is politics.

This was a great class.  I see a lot of people rated this class low, but professor Chabot makes it very easy to get a good grade if you do the work.  For every chapter she has a study guide with the specific pages you should read and the questions you must be able to answer.  While this is time consuming it is an easy way to get an A.

Class is boring. Harder then it needs to be. Alot of info required for exams. Basically a waste of time. Expected us to know too much when no one cared. extra credit quizzes,optional paper. dont take unless you actually like geography. i regretted wasting money, time and energy on the class.

the class was pretty hard definitely read the book and the study guide she gives, all the test questions come from there, lecture was a little boring but mandatory. Overall funny teacher but makes the class harder than it should be and easy extra credit points!

This class was supposed to be a GEC, and she made it much more difficult. Her lectures were pointless yet you were required to go to them because of the quizzes. She would spend most of the time telling stories rather than actually teaching the material

This is a pretty easy class. She offers easy extra credit map quizzes and the project you have to do is graded very easily. The tests are not bad either, but you have to put some effort in. The only bad thing is you have to read the book and attendance is required and she is pretty boring, but overall should be an easy A- or A

Class is super-easy so long as you follow prof's very excellent online reading guides. Map quizzes are extra credit and project isn't really that hard. Class is pretty dry but a good way to learn about a lot of different places.

This class was very easy but you MUST attend class or your grade gets docked.  Do all the readings on carmen and follow those questions  because those are verbatim on the exams.  Quizzes are all extra credit and can really pad your grade.  Paper is graded tough.

Oh my goodness. I was feeling homocidal in at least 90% of the lectures because they were so boring. The in-class videos were from the 1980's and were just painful to watch. You must read the textbook. Finished with over 100%, but I am not sure it was worth it at all. Take the class with a more interesting professor.
dry

Although the class is very easy as long as you read the book and take the hour or so to study for the 8 quizzes, she is an AWFUL teacher. Not only is attendance mandatory, but you have to listen to her monotone voice talk about things that are irrelevant to the tests. Bring other work or sleep. Class is pointless other than the videos shown.

I don't even know. She talked every class about pointless things that didn't show up on our exams at all, including staying on 1 map for an hour. She seems passionate about the class but it was nothing like I expected and going to mandatory lecture stupid, it would have been better to read the book each 2 hours we had class. Not recommended, sadly.

Very easy class, although somewhat boring.  Lectures were almost painful to sit through, and attendance was mandatory.  Quizzes were a easy, exams even easier, finished with like a 99% or something ridiculous.

Shes a very sweet lady. Sit in the front or else you probably will find it difficult to pay attention. She tends to drone on. As the class progressed it got more and more interesting. Read the textbook material and fill out the study/reading guides she gives you. They are extremely helpful. STUDY FOR THE EX. CREDIT QUIZES. They will save your grade

She takes attendance and you're only allowed 2 absences before it hurts your grade. Also, she gives extra credit in the form of quizzes which is hard to get because you have to memorize like 100 countries and cities combined, no joke. Three tests make up the class so if you don't test well.. not recommended..

She is really nice and always offers students her help. The the class is compromised of 3 tests. She also has about 8 quizzes where she will give you a list of 30-50 countries and cities you have to find on a blank map. On the quiz, she picks only 5 cities and countries which is rediculous! The quizzes can't hurt your grade though, just help it 4%

This lecturer really means well but she habitually underestimates our intelligence. She actually felt it was necessary to define lattitude and longitude for us. Her lectures are highly disorganized which makes it difficult to study for her exams. This has the potential to be a really great class but she skims over important points for trivialities.

To be quite honest it was one of the worst classes I have taken at OSU. She was the type of teacher that after the midterm you would look to the person sitting next to you and say 'What? when did we ever learn about X?'. Pure and complete nonsense.
As the others said, boring class, so bring a book, or laptop, etc. because she takes attendance (or just have a buddy sign the sheet for you).

This class is a joke.  She takes attendence, though lectures are pointless.  Lots of grade padding (10 "cushion" points on the exams) and extra credit opportunities.  She gives you a lot of material to know for the exams, but just fill out the end of chapter questions on Carmen and you will do fine.

I think there is just far too much material for these exams.  There is a ton of material that is fair game to use on the exam and it can be overwhelming.  The homework definately helps boost your grade, but I think the weekly quizzes are just marginally helpful for the exams.

This class is awful.  The tests are pretty rediculious considering you basically dont really know what's going to be on them.  She doesnt give a study guide and just stands up in the middle of class and rambels on for two hours.  Take another 597 class....

This class is so boring. Her tests are ridiculous...you pretty much have to study EVERYTHING...lectures..hand outs...readings...videos...maps, EVERYTHING. She gives u the test format but not a study guide...so you really don't know what will show up. I hate her class. Don't take this is you are trying to fulfill a GEC!

This class is extremely boring and if it can be substituted for another class I would really recommend it.  Attendance probably isnt required if ur not going for an A but the amount of material on the exams is just ridiculous.  Its almost impossible to study that much material on one of the most boring subjects out there, good luck

Easy easy class, tons of extra credit and grade padding, if you can't get at least a B in this class, you either aren't going to class or aren't staying awake. Prof. Chabot is a really nice lady, and simplifies the concepts very well, although maybe a little too well. Either way, do the work and it's and easy A.
The class in itself is reallllly boring but there is tons of extra credit.  If you do all the homework questions and at least half listen to the lectures, a good grade is really easy to get.

shady with the attendence.  does not change grade when its boarder line when a student attendents to all her classes. i and never walked out in the middle of her lectures like others.  find another geog 597 prof.  i heard the other one is a nice person.  her tests are base off the book or lecture.   her avg class grade was c+

She made the class fun and the material easy to understand.  She also had a great sense of humor and was very knowledgeable.  As a bonus, she got me interested in Michael Palin's travel documentaries.

summary_comment: The professor is known for being enthusiastic about the material but struggles to convey it effectively, leading to confusion among students. The class lacks a clear structure, with assignments and readings often given with little guidance, and lectures failing to clarify the content. Students find the material and assessments challenging and difficult to follow.

Ratings.comment: This prof is enthusiastic about the work she gives us but the work is hard to understand, the readings make no sense, her lectures leave all of us more confused. There is no clear structure to the class, as we were given 3 papers to write with less than a week's notice - without any clear guidelines or direction.

She is very vague and doesn't explain anything. The whole class is lost in what she's trying to get across. Expect homework, readings, pop quizzes, and talking in front of the class as well. The readings are hard to understand as well. Very hard to listen to. Mostly lecture classes.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as having poor lecturing skills, with students finding his lectures confusing and monotonous. Many describe his teaching style as ineffective, with long, rambling sessions that often include irrelevant examples and require significant effort to stay engaged.

Ratings.comment: Lectures are confusing. He is very confusing to understand. Monotone.

This man is probably the worst teacher/lecturer Ive had in my three years here. He would ramble in a monotone voice for almost 3hrs in a way that made it 100x more confusing, mainly saying irrelevant examples then backtracking. I have never had such a hard time forcing myself to stay awake in a lecture. Hes a sweet man, sure, but a TERRIBLE prof.

summary_comment: Professor Rawson is generally supportive and accommodating, offering help with assignments and extensions, though some students found the class structure, particularly the numerous group projects and lengthy discussion posts, to be challenging. The material can be engaging once understood, and the professor provides necessary resources and clear feedback. However, the class can be overwhelming due to extensive bus-related activities and a heavy final project, and some students felt the content was biased and one-sided.

Ratings.comment: This class was mostly just discussion posts and quizzes for each module with the final project being a teaching demo. Rawson is willing to help if you reach out and does not penalize turning in assignments late. However, some of the discussion posts were really long and took forever. As long as you keep up with the assignments, you will be fine.
The type of teacher to give homework over breaks
Too many group projects/activities, she just reads off the powerpoint presentation

She's very nice and easy to reach outside of the class. She's also very easy to talk to about extensions and grading. The attendance was written response questions every class. The class had a semester long group project, requiring you to use the bus to travel Columbus. Not my favorite, and the class wasn't very interesting, but she wasn't horrible

She reads off her slides and never elaborates on information she can't use Carmen correctly and when in the midst of crazy finals and our finals weren't submitting correctly she was nowhere to be found. The worst part was that she made us do 12 weeks of research just for us to write a paper that only needed 2-3 sources per person. don't take it!!

This class was a little tricky to get the hang of at first, but once you get a feel for things the material is actually quite interesting. Rawson is super helpful if you reach out, & is very willing to assist you if you need help with an assignment or help reviewing exam materials. She'll give you all the materials & information you need to succeed

Lots of bus work, the class sh*t on capitalism the whole time. Very one sided and failed to blame rich for poors problems. As a conservative I had to keep my mouth shut to get the A. Massive project at end of year. Teacher very clear and gives good feedback if you ask her with interest.

summary_comment: Dr. Xiao is known for his challenging and fast-paced teaching style, particularly suitable for students with prior programming experience, especially those transitioning from computer science to GIS. His lectures and notes are generally helpful, but the class demands significant time and effort, including numerous projects and exams. Students note that the course can be overwhelming for beginners or those lacking coding background, often requiring extensive self-study and support outside of class.

Ratings.comment: Lectures & notes are pretty helpful. Heavier assignments like exams/projects/HW can be rough though

NOT A BEGINNER CODING CLASS, do not take 5222 if you do not know how to code. this class is brutally unforgiving and very very difficult. Long and numerous projects, 3 timed midterms i never finished, a final project, timed final exam, final homework(another project), and 2 final assigment all due within 3 days of each other. I grinded and got a C

He spends about 6 weeks teaching coding fundamentals, then expects you to apply and understand those fundamentals at a high level AND go "beyond" by creating your own projects/solutions. Definitely a brutal class if you don't know how to code. projects would take me 20+ hours of pain, and there are 4 as well as assigments every week regardless

If you have coded extensively before, this class will be a nice review with lots of interesting GIS applications to coding topics explained. If you have not coded extensively before you will drown and the class is an insane amount of work. Xiao is friendly, but the class is built for CS majors who switched into GIS. Good luck

Dr. Xiao is funny and gives you every opportunity to succeed. Lectures walk you through most of what you need to know to complete homework. Pay attention, be resourceful outside of class by looking for online sources of coding insights in Python, go to him right away if you hit a snag and you will do fine.

Dr Xiao is a very skilled GIScientist. Sometimes, I think he forgets that undergrads aren't on his level. But he's super accessible and helpful outside of class for lab work. Great sense of humor in lectures. Moves very fast through material. Best to look at things ahead of class and come with questions ready because he won't slow down for long

If you don't have programming experience this is not the course for you. He makes a lot of mistakes in lecture but is not clear how to fix the mistakes. He'll teach you real basic concepts but then ask you to do advanced things without giving you all the tools. He takes advantage of the fact that many CSE majors change to GIS .

I took it this semester and I'm probably going to end up with an A in it, but I learned absolutely nothing. I knew nothing about GIS before the class, and I know nothing about it now. The material was relatively easy to learn, but nothing made sense and I didn't understand anything in any of his lectures. I only went to lecture to get points.

Professor Xiao's class was the best I've taken so far. He makes the material easy to understand and entertains with his understated sense of humor. His comprehensive study guides make tests easy if you study. The labs can be pretty hard but if you go to office hours, he's extremely helpful. Would recommend for anyone interested in GIS.

Explains class material pretty well. Missing in-class assignments brought my grade down from an A to B+ but the material was easy enough that I didn't need lecture or the book to understand it, the slides alone were enough. Labs were easy. Final project is fun as you get to make your own map on GIS, but Dr. Xiao grades this pretty tough.

This professor appeared to be harsh and strict but internally a very nice person. He may be the best, if not only, person in the dept you should go to if you have any questions about GIS. He offers a useful and also A booster class for those who have some experience in GIS and know a little programming.
When I took his intermediate GIS class, I learned a great deal.  Ninchuan makes class fun, and even with his strong accent, he speaks well. You can easily tell that he knows a lot about GIS.

Maybe the class became easier this quarter, but this class wasn't hard in any way. The content of the class was definitely boring, but in no way hard. 3 Exams, 8 easy Labs, 1 Map Project (which was really fun).
lots of work
dr. xiao takes alot of****. his classes are generally boring... but overall hes really not a bad guy, if you go into his office once he'll favor you
I wanted to kill myself EVERY second of this class.  It was the hardest class I've ever taken and he truly has NO MERCY.  Do not take this class and save yourself from the stress!!!!!!!

summary_comment: Dr. EMT is highly regarded as a knowledgeable and dedicated professor, known for her expertise and willingness to help students. Her classes involve significant work, including presentations, group projects, and challenging quizzes, but she is generally an easy grader. Students find her approachable and impressed by her commitment to learning and her field of study, which includes Antarctica.

Ratings.comment: Dr. EMT is one of the coolest professors I've ever had. Go google her if you don't know her work. The class had a lot of presentations and group projects but she is a very easy grader. Also start writing the final paper early; it's not that long but she stacked a lot of assignments toward the end of the semester.

Nice woman, passionate about her subject area. I took this class thinking there would be more of a geography and human impact focus, but it turned out being much more atmospheric sciences-focused. It still turned out interesting enough, though some lectures were a little boring. Grading isn't difficult and projects can be interesting.

Dr. EMT is a great professor. She is very knowledgable and one of the most respected people in her field. I learned a lot and really valued her input. If anyone ever had a question, she would make sure to have it answered by the next class if she didn't know the answer. The class is hard, quizzes very hard, and you will stress out all semester.

It's an interesting topic, and EMT is willing to help.  That said, she did not divide the workload fairly between debate groups and didn't seem to realize we had other classes. She doesn't grade the busywork THAT easily, either. It's not a bad honors science option, and the field trip to Byrd Polar is cool. I liked the interdisciplinary approach.

Great professor and class. Didn't care about the topic at all beforehand and ended up being one of my favorite courses. No exams, but there are quizzes and a few group projects. Pretty easy grader, but make sure to study for the quizzes. Field trip to Byrd Polar was so much fun! Take this class if you can, Prof. Thompson is awesome!

Loved debates and trip to the Byrd Polar Research Center.  Whenever students raised questions in class she didn't know the answers to, she ALWAYS started the next class with the answers to these questions. She is a worldwide expert in her field, yet is SO sincere and humble, and loves to learn from her students. Very impressive prof; great class.
Dr. EMT is a sweetheart and very knowledgeable, but her class is a lot of work. Expect to be stressing out all semester long if you take this class.

Having someone who actually works in the field - the field being Antarctica - makes the subject much more interesting and relevant. There was more work than I expected but it was all easy and related to modern issues, forcing us to understand them. I've never taken a course with a professor who truly tries to make you a better all around person.

There seemed to be a ton of assignments but she grades very easy. It would be worse if she graded hard but it's still a lot of work and that was a pain. She's very nice and is interested in her students and the topic but sometimes classes got off track and she seems a little disorganized.

Thankfully, she's a very easy grader for a bunch of behemoth work. She tries to organize things using a daily schedule for class, but somehow still comes across as confusing and scattered. Lectures are bipolarly paced, and she doesn't always emphasize what she thinks is important. Kyung-In is an amazing TA, however.

Best Class!! I agree with everyone else, you will learn so much and it will change your perspective on everything.  If you're looking for a class that'll make you think but there's no useless busywork take this one!!

Amazing class. Good amount of work, but its all very interesting and relevant.  Lots of group work makes for some easy grades.  The topic is very interesting, she really cares about the students and the subject matter and if you can take a class from her you will love yourself.  Not hard to do well either.

Best class I've taken at OSU. When you have a professor who actually cares about the subject AND the students, you can't go wrong. It's a lot of work, but if you put forth the effort, you'll do well. Ask questions, go to office hours, and READ. Take this class, and you'll learn a lot. Should be a required class. You won't regret it.
Dr EMT was a great professor

summary_comment: Dr. Dutta is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, particularly for non-major students, known for her engaging teaching style, laid-back approach, and passion for the subject matter. Her courses, such as GEOG 5501, focus on discussions, films, and community walks, fostering a supportive and inspiring learning environment. Students appreciate her understanding of out-of-class circumstances and her willingness to help, though some find the workload, especially towards the end of the semester

Ratings.comment: Dr Dutta has been my best professor in 4 years at OSU, and I'm not even a Geog major. 5501 was great, based on discussing readings and films, a group project, and community walks. It was super laid back so if you do the work you'd do well. Dr. Dutta is so kind and inspiring and passionate, I wish I could take more courses with her!

Dr. Dutta has been my most impactful professor during my time at OSU. Not even a Geography major, took 5501 on a recommendation. 5501 was great, mostly built around discussing readings & films, & community walks too. I learned so much and loved the laid back structure, and Dr. Dutta is so inspiring and supportive! Do the work, & you'll do well!

Took 2400.02. Professor is very understanding of out-of-class circumstances and is willing to work with students. Weekly quizzes on videos/podcasts that can be over an hour long. Very lenient exam grader. The final group research project was a lot of work during the last couple weeks, but nothing overly tedious.

Prof Dutta was very good and her TAs were very helpful. She genuinely wants her students to do well, but with it being online if you didn't understand the material you almost NEEDED to go to office hours. Overall she was great. Only thing I will say is the second midterm and the final were about a week apart, felt a little rushed on that end.

This course is not hard and the professor and ta were very understanding and helpful. The final group project was annoying but was graded on what was individually done by each member so it was not difficult to get a good grade. The exams are open book essay questions that were open all day and just ask you just to draw from lecture to answer them.

This class was okay but the work was a little excessive. Two midterms with a final group project AND final 5 page essay. Not to mention that the group project, the second midterm, and the final were all due in the last three weeks. Could just be me but I don't know that seems to be a little overkill.

She is one of the coolest professors I have had at OSU! Her and her TAs are extremely easygoing and care about you learning the content. As long as you watch the lectures, the midterms are a slice of cake. Reading and films are also pretty interesting. The final project can be a lot but time manage with your group! She is awesome--would take again.

Favorite class so far at OSU! Most assignments are essays graded based on integrating ideas from the lectures and the readings, which is a great way to test knowledge! However, some lectures felt unorganized and the final is weighted too much (50% of class grade). Just read the readings and participate in class and it's easy and fun! Field trips!

Madhumita is awesome. Her lectures can be scattered, but she's very passionate and experienced, absolutely worth your time. Her class was loosely organized and discussion-based, an easy A but a hard A+. Come into her class with an open mind.
great course, I learned so much and the professor goes above and beyond to integrate what we learn in class with real-world problems. I would recommend this course and any others that she teaches!

attendance is 10% of the score, class participation is 10% and or other 80% is based on the midterms and final, exams are open books open internet short essay questions, there is no correct answer, you should be creative and reliable. seldom lecture nots post on canvas, listen to the professor carefully!

SEI.Subject: GEOG
SEI.Class Name: Urban Spaces in the Global Economy

summary_comment: Dr. Quiring is highly regarded by many students for his supportive approach and engaging lectures, though some find his classes demanding, especially in the latter part of the semester. While some students appreciate his efforts to ensure academic integrity by increasing the weight of exams, others struggle with the difficulty and workload, leading to lower grades. Overall, he is seen as a dedicated professor who genuinely wants his students to succeed.

Ratings.comment: I need to make this clear, this professor has CHANGED, not the same one that people have raved about. In an effort to crack down on cheating, he's made the tests 60% of your total grade and they're HARD, paper and pencil. If you can get out of taking a class with him, DO IT. His new policies are hurting everyones grades, he's been my only C at OSU

Dr. Quiring is a great professor! While lectures can be dull from time to time, he does well making the content applicable through assignments. He wants everyone to succeed and is more than willing to help outside of class when needed. Exams are nearly identical to assignments & content. Would strongly recommend him!
Dr. Quiring is great to work with!

Dr. Quiring is a great professor. He wants everyone in the class to succeed and is there to help every step of the way. He made the material interesting and fun. His exams were straight forward. I would recommend him to anyone.

Dr. Quiring was a really good prof. He gives interesting lectures and really cares about the success of his students. Yes the class involves a decent amount of work, but its a class where you learn so much. I would recommend this class to anyone.

The first half of the semester was great (just assignments and a midterm), but after spring break we had to read 120+ pages of scientific papers a week, present on one, write a 12 page final paper, AND have a final exam. Overall, he was great but it was very work heavy for his first semester teaching it. Just make sure not to fall behind.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as challenging and unhelpful, with many students finding the class difficult and assignments harshly graded. Comments suggest he can be unfriendly and even rude, with one student explicitly advising to avoid his classes. Overall, his teaching approach is seen as outdated and his lectures are described as boring and hard to follow.

Ratings.comment: Worst class I have ever taken. Teacher is not helpful, class is extremely hard, and the assignments are graded very hard. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Professor is difficult, but not impossible. In my experience he has been very kind, if not all that helpful. Slightly ambiguous in his explanations. You HAVE to attend class and you HAVE to read the textbook to understand what he is teaching. Be prepared for a shock on the first midterm, but he gives extra credit and the class gets easier.
Outdated approach to topic. Unfriendly to the point of being rude at times. Find a way to avoid taking a class from this person.
Not a nice person.
Terrible teacher.  Extremely boring and VERY HARD! You will more than likely fail his classes.

summary_comment: Dr. O'Kelly is known for being passionate and knowledgeable but often rambles, making his lectures less engaging. Students find the material and class structure challenging, particularly the midterms, though the final exams are generally easier. While some appreciate his responsibility and find the class manageable despite its difficulties, others strongly advise against taking his courses due to their perceived boredom and complexity.

Ratings.comment: Passionate and knowledgeable. Tries to make the material relatable. Rambles on often. Not a very interesting class.

his lectures are boring but they are basically all he tests on. one group project and group paper which take a lot of the grade. 3 exams but they were all curved. really interesting but not my favorite prof.

His midterms are tough but luckily his final wasn't too bad as long as you study the previous exams.  The stuff you have to do in the class isn't that interesting and feels like it drags on.  He doesn't grade the essays, papers, and projects very difficult so that may make up for the horrible midterms.  Class feels tough but balances out in the end

This class is extremely difficult. Dr. O'Kelly makes it a math class for the exam and never really explains anything that well. Lectures are dull and boring, and seem to drag on for ages. If you are a security and intelligence major and thought this class sounds interesting guess again. The class is terrible.
nice and responsible

I found this class very easy, and my only criticism of Dr. O'Kelly is that I wished he would push us along a little faster so that we could cover things more in-depth.  I  would definitely take a class with him again.

Im not sure it is his fault, but the Geography of Transportation course material was just difficult for me to understand. I understood some concepts and basic calculations, but not the in-depth theories,which there were many of.

Dr. O'Kelly is the most boring professor I have ever had.  Avoid taking any of his classes at all costs.  The class I had was seriously torture.  It doesn't help that the course matter itself is extremely boring.

summary_comment: Professor Malecki is highly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject matter, making the class engaging despite its dry lectures and traditional teaching methods. While his grading can be subjective and his expectations for papers are strict, students find the class manageable and often rewarding, with minimal testing and a focus on writing assignments. Overall, students appreciate his accessibility and willingness to help, though some find his teaching style and grading criteria somewhat old-fashioned.

Ratings.comment: Professor Malecki is extremely knowledgable and well-connected, but very old-school in his ways. He cares very much about the subject but sometimes too much. Lectures can be boring but he makes them somewhat interesting with YouTube videos. He doesn't care if you pay attention. The class was extremely interesting and is an easy A.
A very nice professor, if you are interested in city planning and development and dont want to have a heavy course. I strongly recommend you to take his class

Prof. Malecki is a solid professor. His lectures are long and dry, but he really doesn't care if you don't pay attention. Readings aren't super necessary, but you still need to at least skim through all. A few big papers, no tests. Be sure to know the criteria of the papers because you will lose lots of points if you don't follow them strictly.

Easy class, attendance counts so make sure you're there. basically just lectures, some papers, no exams! Grading criteria is a little weird, just make sure you ask him if you have any questions. overall great class and professor.

Ed's class was interesting and easy. There are surveys before every class to ensure you read, however it's open ended so all you really need to do is open up to one page and read one section. No tests, but a couple of easy papers and a final project that isn't too bad. Great class, and he honestly learned all 40 students' names.

You write a good paper, you will get a good grade. No exams! You do have to do a survey before almost every class. I gave him a 2 for clarity because it is a lot of gray area for his grading. Papers grade can sometimes become 2-sided and you can expect the lower of the 2. He doesn't update grades in real-time for surveys; final grade disappointing.

I think this has been one of my favorite classes this year. Malecki was always showing us information that I either didn't know anything about, or I knew about but didn't have extensive knowledge on. I liked how he taught the class and he was always extremely accommodating for students. It was a great class, I'd take it again.

Dr. Malecki is very intelligent and it is clear that he enjoys teaching. He is not a hard grader but does have strict guidelines for papers. He is willing to help and responds to emails promptly. I greatly enjoy this class.

This man is brilliant.Just ... brilliant. Grades are only comprised of essays--even the final-- and homework. You can complete the essays anytime during the semester. He places all his powerpoints online and they are really good for finding research sources. I greatly enjoyed this class.

Really nice guy and very authoritative in his field of study. Class is an easy A if you put it enough effort, but he's really bad at giving directions, overcome this obstacle and you'll have a good time in his class.

If you know how to write a decent paper this class is easy enough. No exams just papers and make sure you do the readings and summarize them online before class. Hes a fair grader on papers. Make sure you go to class the days he shows videos because there are online "quizzes" over them.

He's a great professor. Definetly makes what could be dry material interesting. Do the readings, he picks great books. Class is a mixture of lecture, powerpoints and videos. Fair grader on the papers.
Makes the class very interesting.  Extremely helpful during office hours.  Highly recommend taking any class that he teachs.

Material that would normally be very boring becomes interesting when he teaches it. While he and class are relaxed, attendance and nightly reading summaries are important. All in all, he is a high quality Prof.

He's big on overall themes and concepts as opposed to specific dates/numbers. I stopped reading the book around week 5, you probably don't need the book. I learned a lot about cities and how they fit into the global economy and what makes "global cities" global. Bonus: he is ALWAYS in his office and makes himself available to students basically whe

Great content for the class. 4 2-3 page papers, a 6 page paper, 5 quizes, and no final OR midterm (he doesn't like them). Very interesting material on cities. Learned a lot. You can probably get by without the book, although it wasn't very expensive anyway. Professor Malecki is awesome!

A nice guy, but, as others have said, you won't learn a ton in his class except what you read in the books. Goes through powerpoints way too fast for you to retain any of the info. Books are interesting, but I didn't feel like I learned a ton by going to class. An easy A as long as you do the work if you need a GPA boost.
Don't take his class. terrible class.

The favorable review two reviews down was a special circumstance. Is Professor Malecki a nice/cool guy? Answer:Yes. Will you learn anything from him as a TEACHER/Professor? Answer:NO. He just goes through the motions tells and you to learn from the readings. In class he blazes through a powerpoint without a moments hesitation. Horrible class.

He is not a true professor. He is a "professional" who has a job in teaching. The subject matter is fascinating, but you'd be better served going to a library and reading the books on his syllabus. Random pop quizzes for attendance and 3 papers worth 60% of final grade. The most disappointing class in my OSU career. No substance weird grading scale

He is truly a born teacher. I picked up a geog. minor after taking his (he designed it) Geography 450 class. When I was ill, Dr. Malecki did everything he could to help me out and keep me up to speed with everyone else. He was always very fair and made success easy for all students. I paid attention because I wanted to, not because I had to.

I love this guy! Easy grader, comments on your papers, lectures don't really matter, everything is over the reading. This is one of the first classes I read every text cover to cover because all of his readings were very interesting. Final is a take-home that was challenging, but not busy work.
Very clear and easy to understand.  Very likeable and he really likes what he does.  You should do the reading he assigns.  His fair.  A good grade isn't a breeze but is far from impossible.
Great Guy
Very helpful and understanding.  Work load is fair and not to demanding.  Take the class.
Excellent instructor! One of the best at OSU! I'd take anything from him.
I second that... great class and a very dedicated learner/teacher.
One of the best professors OSU.  Class is well worth it and not very hard.

summary_comment: Dr. Ahlqvist is highly knowledgeable but faces significant criticism for his teaching style and workload. Students find the lectures boring and the material challenging, while the grading, especially for labs, is perceived as harsh. The class also requires substantial out-of-class work, including volunteer hours and extensive homework, which many find overwhelming and time-consuming.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Ahlqvist is an extremely knowledgable professor. However, the grading in this class is horrendous, particularly, the labs. The lectures were extremely boring and the material was pretty difficult. Also, this is a service class which requires you to do volunteer work at various libraries. If you are required to take this class, good luck.
Overloads you with homework without bothering to consider that you may actually have a ton of homework for all your other classes already. It is not hard, just way too much boring work.

Most of his online class is just watching hour long documentaries on topics which could be easily explained in a matter of 10-20 minutes. One or two are fine, but it is annoying when there are 4-6 lined up and all it amounts to are a 4 question multiple choice quiz. It consumed way more time than a 3 credit hr. class.
recitation is useless and boring but not lecture. large workload. If you put more effort in it I think it's not that hard to get an A.

i cant believe a 3 credits class should give us 10 credits' work and the hw takes me a loooot of time to finish that, and it's super boring!!! it's hard to get a good grade, both the class and the recitation are super boring!!! ATTENTION, no this class!!!

recitation is sooooo boring, and the recitation hw take a lot of time and boring and meaningless. However, this is an interesting class, you may know lots of things of other countries. You can get a decent grade(A-,B+) if you pay some efforts.

I thought this was going to be a fairly easy class since i have taken other Geography classes and they were easy. WRONG expect an overload of HW, Quizzes, recitation busy-work, and a ton of reading.  I caution you to reconsider taking this professor. He is a great guy and knows the topic but.. not great at the presentation.

I took this class expecting a simple GE, but it is a ridiculous waste of time.  Recitations have nothing to do with lectures & there is a long busy work assignment each week on top of lecture assignments & quizzes.  Class does not prep you for quizzes. No midterms, only final. DO NOT TAKE

The class can be dry and boring.  He is a good professor; however, I think more time should be put into preparing for quizzes and reviewing important material during recitation. Recitation assignments are busy work (personally, not helpful towards learning about class content). If you are looking to do well, I do NOT recommend this as a GE.

The class is a decent amount of work. He teaches the class pretty well. The tests are quite difficult even if you think you know the material. But they aren't a high percentage of your grade, labs are. Labs are overall pretty easy. This class is hard to get an A in unless you can do well on the tests, but if you try, you should get a B hands down.
Very helpful.  Keeps class interesting.  Helps whenever he can.  Would reccomend his class.

Class can be dry but not for a lack of trying. He definitly helped me out and made exceptions and gave extensions but don't push your luck with too many excuses. Labs aren't too hard but be sure to be on time with them. Test can be tricky and aren't as easy as he says they will be.

summary_comment: This professor is generally regarded as knowledgeable and willing to help students who seek clarification, though his lectures can be long and sometimes confusing, leading to difficulty in studying for exams. While some find his classes and labs straightforward, others struggle with the challenging tests and find his teaching style dry and monotonous. Overall, while the professor is helpful when approached, the course can be demanding and not suitable for all students, especially those who prefer a more engaging teaching style.

Ratings.comment: I really liked this professor as he wasn't a tough grader. However, his lectures can be confusing and his test questions often don't align with what we learn in class. It can be really difficult to study for some exam questions because it isn't quite clear what he expects.

Dr. Rogers is respected in the field and really knows the material.  I can tell that he was passionate about the subject, but he was just a boring teacher.  He would read directly from the slides and move really fast. The class was pretty easy, and none of his assignments were that hard.  He is helpful if you visit outside of class.

Labs are short and simple! Lectures are long  but attendance points are given. Test are difficult.  Not the easiest GE  because of how difficult he makes the test. There is so much material on each exam. I feel that he forgets that this class is just a GE and also refuses to drop lowest exam grade and is against giving out bonus.
Lectures are a bit long, but if you don't understand something Rogers is more than happy to help for as long as necessary to clarify the material.  Very helpful over the last three semesters.

The lectures are long and boring. He talks in a monotone voice and it is very hard to pay attention to what he is saying. For tests, he provides study guides that are helpful but his questions can be confusing. The labs are pretty easy and he gives participation quizzes in class so those can definitely save your grade. Don't take if you want easy.

This is an intro level geography course that simply fulfills a GEC and I have gotten horrible grades on the exams. Reads straight off the powerpoint slides. Dry. Dull. He is a super sweet guy, but his lectures are just painful to sit through. If science doesn't come easy for you, do not take this course.

Great professor. A little dry but material was easy.  Gave out a study guide for every exam which was multiple choice. If you memorized the study guide, the test was a breeze. Labs were easy compared to engineering lab reports
I thought this class was very challenging but he honestly isn't that bad of a professor. It's passable, just difficult. If science is particularly hard for you, I would avoid him.

His class is one of the most reasonable in this semester. I don't see any point why other folks did so bad in the exam and criticize him. His lecture is a bit dry. His study guide is like a bunch of questions but you can find the answers by visiting him during office hours or find the TAs. He is very helpful and answers email even during weekend.

Good class but as a professor not sure why he's teaching the class. Very dull and uninteresting. Most people in class simply use the computer as he can't keep anyones attendtion. Very informative but might want to do something other than teach.

He reads right off the slides and if you're used to skipping classes he gives these mini quizzes after virtually every class. He goes over class time by 5 minutes everyday. The biggest thing is seriously the slide thing though, word for word of those things, so you don't really even have to listen to him. I recommend a text book, self taught myself

Don't take this class. Rogers does not understand Geo 120 is a GEC. The averages on the exams were 66, 69 then a whopping 57 on the final. He has unrealistic expectations for the class. It is boring and he pretty much reads the slides. It was a huge mistake taking this class.

Assignments are hard but usually fun, and Dr. Rogers is always eager to help you understand the material. Presents most material in an interesting and informative way. All in all, one of the best professors i've had thus far.

Dr. Rogers is fantastic.  I took his GEOG 823 as an elective -- I'm a physicist -- and I was blown away by his use of statistics when explaining atmospheric phenomena.  There were lots of assignments but most were fun to do.
not an easy class

DON'T TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!  I USUALLY GET A'S IN MY GEC'S AND THIS CLASS WAS IMPOSSIBLE TO GET AN A IN!!!!! Make sure you start going to class after first midterm because he will randomly do pop quizzes which I still don't even know how those factor into your final grade.  Exams are multiple choice and he makes them impossible.

The professor was OK.  Would have been nice to have access to the powerpoint instead of just PDF files of the powerpoint.   He printed 6 per page which was hard for me to read, make notes and add the missing words.  Also thought the class was way tooo hard for an entry level class.  Too much vocab.
Solid professor for upper-level classes, average for GEC / lower level material. He's a lot more passionate about the synoptic forecasting material. Highly recommend his 600 level courses.
DO NOT TAKE THIS GUYS CLASS

Hardest class I've ever taken, and I'm an A student.  Sad thing about it, is that it was an intro level GEOGRAPHY course that simply fulfills a GEC.  If I had to do it over again I WOULD'VE TAKEN SOMETHING ELSE FOR SURE!!!  The exams are extremely detailed, and merely impossible to pass. Lectures and studyguides are a complete waste of time ...
He's a good guy but reads from power point. If you like that monotone thing, you'll love him. He's VERY helpful! When he gives you a study guide.. RIP IT TO SHREADS! Just know EVERYTHING! LITERALLY.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality and supportive approach. Students appreciate her ability to provide timely assistance despite the online format and note that she goes beyond the curriculum to teach valuable life skills such as effective communication. Her classes are so well-regarded that many students wish to take multiple courses with her.

Ratings.comment: She is a very nice person. I learned a lot from her class. Even though I take the class online at home, she can still offer her help quickly. She taught more than the class material, she taught me how to communicate with others more friendly. I would like to take more of her classes.

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered not effective by students, primarily due to forcing them to use a testing center for exams rather than allowing in-class assessments. Despite the class being described as fairly boring, the professor is genuinely interested in the subject and offers multiple ways to earn extra credit. Additionally, while the textbook is not strictly necessary, it can be helpful, and the grading system focuses on four exams and map quizzes, with attendance and note-taking being key to success.

Ratings.comment: Not good
She forces you to go to the stupid testing center instead of taking exams in classes.

Class is fairly boring, however the professor really is interested in the topic and wants all of her students to do well. The class has multiple ways to get extra credit and the map quizzes are easy to do well in. The book isn't necessary, but I found it helpful. If you do the study guides and read it over a few times this class won't be a problem.

Cynthia is an amazing lecturer. The course is very interesting and she adds some anecdotes that can help connect to the material. The grade is based on 4 exams and some map quizzes. I never bought the textbook, which you can get by on doing only if you attend every class and take notes on the lecture.

summary_comment: Deniz is widely regarded as an exceptional professor at Ohio State, significantly impacting students' educational experiences. Her teaching is highly influential, with many students continuing to reflect on her classes long after graduation. Ohio State is fortunate to have her as part of its faculty.

Ratings.comment: Deniz is an incredible professor and Ohio State is lucky to have her. She was one of the most influential people and taught one of the most influential classes of my education at OSU. More than a year later, I think about what I learned in that class on a regular basis.

summary_comment: Professor Carr, a Ph.D. student, demonstrated strong organizational skills and effective teaching despite his lack of prior GIS coursework experience. The class, an introduction to GIS with a focus on ArcGIS, was well-structured, featuring a midterm, a final exam, and straightforward weekly lab sessions.

Ratings.comment: This class was an introduction to GIS.  Their is a lab component that focuses solely on ARGIS applications.  Professor Carr is a Ph.D student.  He freely admits that he never took a GIS class himself but he did a good job teaching.  It was his first class but it was very well organized.  One midterm, final, and weekly ARGIS labs that were easy.

summary_comment: Ms. Luginbuhl is highly regarded for her thorough knowledge and supportive teaching approach, often going above and beyond to ensure students understand the material. While some find her exams challenging and the content more political science-oriented than expected, her assistance and approachability are widely praised.

Ratings.comment: Ms. Luginbuhl I thought was an excellent teacher. i had a hard time at first due to a terrible class (not hers) when i expressed concern she readily helped.  Also sent emails to make sure i was understanding everything from there on out. She is very knowledgeable and helpful!

I agree with the last comment, there was alot of material that wasn't covered in class that was on the exam.  And I DID read the insanely large amount of reading material as well.  Her lectures were interesting but it was not what I expected for a world regional geography class.  It seemed more like a poli sci class.  Grading was pretty harsh.
Exams cover issues not explained in class.
april rocks and rolls!
she's a great TA... approachable and easy to understand, even when she gets lost in a topic
This is a great class for those of us who are not into science, especially physical science. April is really nice and helpful, and very concise with the material she presents. Take her class!
The labs for this class was a joke, but she taught the class very well and will make the effort to answer every question that she gets.
On time, knows the material well.  OK sense of humor, especially when pertaining to her spelling and artistic abilities.  I would recommend her to most anyone.
She was a TA when I took this class with Dr. Bryan Mark.  Very helpful and her lab's were easy.

She was a TA for Professor Robbins. She lectured a few times and was good, but said "right?" a few too many times... it got annoying. VERY helpful outside class... she went over exams with people and that helped clarify the material.
Very cute, pretty easy class; "Here is my lame drawing of Ohio";nice person,very helpful; a little disorganized,but not too bad.

summary_comment: The professor is known for delivering an easily understandable course and consistently providing online PowerPoint slides from lectures. While attendance is occasionally taken as part of participation, her teaching quality is generally high and well-received by students.

Ratings.comment: Attendance is taken some times, as participation. It's a very easy class to understand, and she provides the powerpoint slides from lecture online.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as highly effective and engaging, with many students praising his clear explanations, sense of humor, and helpful PowerPoint presentations that aid exam preparation. He assigns substantial writing tasks but is generally seen as approachable and responsive to emails. However, some find the class challenging, particularly due to frequent pop quizzes and exams that cover material not heavily emphasized in lectures.

Ratings.comment: Awesome guy, definitely my favorite professor of all time.
Awesome Prof! Don't know why his ratings aren't higher! Very clear, interesting, and funny! Not a terribly difficult class either but a lot of writing

Probably my most enjoyable teacher so far. He is really funny and his power points are very helpful toward the exams. If you study what he tells you to you should be fine on exams. Labs are really easy and help your grade a lot. He tells you the quiz answers beforehand so pop quizzes are nothing to worry about.

Dave's a guy who knows what he's talking about. Has a very dry sense of humor and tends to slip quick ones past his students, if you like that humor than you'll love this class. Quite a bit of writing: 5 two page single spaced papers, a twelve page double spaced paper, a field guide and a biome presentation. He's a great guy, I suggest this class.

An excellent teacher! Extremely enthusiastic about what he does. He's young, makes class fun. He actual goes and does field work (knows what he's taking about!) Puts all power-points on carmen. A few papers- grades easy. Good about responding to emails and willing to help. A really interesting class, defiantly worth taking!

WAY too hard for a GEC. The class itself is extremely boring and the exams are ridiculous-they cover stupid stuff that ou don't learn in class. I'm surprised anyone passes this. Do not take this class you will regret it

His class is boring, scott is a good TA. Exams are hard as hell.i had a 3.4 gpa messed up due to this course. not at all interesting easier science courses available than this , lab is easy and fun.DONT TAKE IT.

This class was not an easy GEC. You had to work for your grade. He has pop quizzes pretty much every lecture. They aren't that hard, just make sure you pay attention to the notes the lecture before and you're good. The exams are kind of tricky. Covers some small things that was not emphasized in class, and there is no curve.
The class was tough and the exams hard. He was really into it and did a good job .
midterms and finals cover obscure stuff.  gives stupid quizzes that he tells you the answer to anyways, just to make you come to class.  pretty cool guy though.
This was a tough class but the professor managed to make interesting and fun!

This professor makes a simple GEC class way too hard.  This was my hardest class thus far and I would study for hours to get a mid C on the midterms.  I am a good student who has an excellent GPA.  This class will only make it worse. Avoid at all costs.

Extremely interesting class, way too much reading and writing though. Two short papers due most weeks, a mid-term paper and presentation and a final paper (12 - 15 pages) with presentation. Steer clear if you don't enjoy reading journal articles and writing research papers.
Teacher is a little bit too excited about the subject for a GEC. He would probably be a good teacher for a higher up level course. If you print out the notes and go to class you will do well.

He makes this class way too hard. It is a GEC! He said that a class average of a 68% on his exam was too high! I mean he needs to look at what he is teaching. It is not like this a major class for most people. It takes up a lot of time, and avoid Porinchu. Quizzes almost everyday too.
funny and attractive

Freakin' hilarious, if you are witty yourself. Unbelievably fair and thorough with the material, but has a severe disdain for those who ask for more (appropriately so). But he stifles this very well, and you can tell he knows it is not fair to punish the rest of the class for the few nimrods who ask for more grace. LOTS of reading, but I recommend.
I did not like him at all.

I took this during the first session of summer school, so automatically it was more challenging.  We did have quizzes everyday, but I'm glad we did because otherwise I don't think any of us would have been able to keep up with the readings.  He is a good professor and interresting...  however this class is challenging!
I really enjoyed this class.

This prof is way too arrogant and he makes the class much more difficult than necessary.  When you go to him for help...good luck getting any! It's a GEC! This class took way too much of my time.  Try another class if you can stay away from Porinchu.
No Comments
A pretty funny guy...easy to understand...I enjoyed class even if it was at 830Am...he makes some fairly funny comments most of the time and had a few good guest lecturers
not helpful at all
TA is absolutely worthless in my case, she barely talks above a whisper and seems to be intimidated by the class.  Porinchu is pretty arogant and not helpful at all if you go to him with questions.
No Comments
great classroom environment, Professor Porinchu really liked the subjects he was teaching about, thus making a 8:30am class enjoyable.
Lectures cover a LOT of material. Interesting course. My TA is what got me through it though. Oh, and about his hotness, would be hotter if he shaved.

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as inconsistent in teaching quality, with some students finding the class easy and interesting while others describe it as boring and poorly taught. Some commend his clarity and helpfulness, while others criticize his teaching methods and attendance policies. Overall, opinions vary widely, with recommendations ranging from highly positive to strongly negative.

Ratings.comment: He is horrible. First of all, he puts you into 4 person groups for 4 assignments (you basically do 1 each, which is stupid). He just talks at you and leaves powerpoints up forever. I actually went to the bathroom and when I came back - we were on the same slide. None of my group members even came to class - oh, me either. Still was extremely easy.
Really easy, but boring.  Spends a lot of time simply reading from his own powerpoints and doesn't ellaborate too much.  Do the study guides and turn assignments in on time.
Really cool guy and the class is very easy. Lectures actually contain substance, something you don't see often. No reason you shouldn't at least get a B, I definately reccomend taking him.

This guy is a TOTAL TOOL. From his greasy ponytail to his incoherent mumbling, it was nearly worthless to actually go to class. Even though the class is called "Transportation SECURITY," it's pretty much all about transportation networks (take 645 if you're interested in that). He teaches full-time at Columbus State; he should stay there.

Great teacher and a great class... he tells you exactly what he expects and only tests on relevant information... knows his subject VERY well and is intelligent as hell when it comes to transportation security.. HIGHLY recommended!
Very helpful and kind.  Willing to answer any questions you have. There is a lot of work, but as long as you do it, you should do well. Uses Powerpoint, but only to help students better understand.

Terrible waste of time.  Reads from powerpoint slides.  This would not be that big of a deal, but apparently he thinks listening to him read from powerpoint is important enough to take attendance.  Attendance is not included in the grade, but somehow, 'failing to attend class will seriously jeopardize your grade'.  Pompous blowhard.

Great class, interesting, very helpful, covers everything in class and tells you what he expects you to know.  If you know this, then you do good.  Take this class, interesting and you learn A LOT without insane studying.  Great guy.

Class can seem boring at times.  However, tests ans assignments are fair.  He goes over an insane amount of information each day in class (30-40 powerpoint slides) but he makes it vary clear what he expects the class to know.  If your interested in any aspect of security I would recommend the class.  He is also very helpful in office hours.

Class is a total waste.  Guy just reads powerpoint slides word-for-word.  No discussion.  Class ia bout transportation security, but he doesn't even talk about it whatsoever.  Guy is on loan from Columbus state and is a little wet behind the ears to be teaching 400 levels at OSU  Take something else

summary_comment: Dr. Hawthorne is highly regarded for his impactful teaching, particularly noted for the significant practical skills and valuable resume material students gain from his class, even if the initial enthusiasm was low. Despite the large project's demanding nature, students appreciate its long-term benefits.

Ratings.comment: Love you, Dr. Hawthorne! We will miss you at OSU!

I wish I had worked harder in this class. I wasn't too exited about it to begin with, but the big project was HUGE and has led to alot of good things for alot of people. Kudos for teaching such an impactful class. The course itself might not give you a thrill, but you get alot of practical skills out of it and shirley some great resumay material.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for their engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, which effectively keeps students interested and motivated. Lectures are well-delivered with stimulating discussions, and while the class involves substantial reading, assessments are straightforward. Students find him both knowledgeable and approachable, whether as a TA or potential instructor.

Ratings.comment: This was a very good class.  A lot of reading involved. No textbook.

Marc is an awesome instructor! Fair bit of reading but tests and journals are pretty straight forward. But his enthusiasm for the subject matter is infectious! He gives very good lectures with stimulating discussion. Highly recommend this guy!
Mr. Auerbach was a great teacher.  He kept the class interested and was very approachable.  The class was pretty difficult but I learned a lot.

Marc TA'd for this class and taught a section of it.  He was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable.  As a TA, he was extremely approachable and helpful.  I imagine as a instructor he will continue to be so.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and genuine passion for his subject matter. Students consistently praise his knowledgeable approach and the significant support provided by his excellent Teaching Assistant, who is noted for being exceptionally helpful and dedicated to student learning.

Ratings.comment: If you take this course, pick this guy! He's so good and really into what he teaches.
Wonderful TA!! the most helpful TA I have ever had. He helps out a lot with the labs and is really interested in helping your learn!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his teaching quality, described as knowledgeable, approachable, and making the class both fun and easy. Students find the course manageable with minimal stress, thanks to straightforward quizzes, followable study guides, and the allowance of cheat sheets during exams. Overall, he is praised for his helpfulness and effectiveness in teaching the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Best professor I've had at Ohio State. Class is not bad if you study for the exams. Map quizzes and homework are real easy points. Really cool and approachable guy who is very knowledgeable in the subject. Would definitely take one of his classes again if I had the opportunity.

Class was easy for the most part.  His quizzes are only on identifying map locations.  His exams always follwed the study guides prior to the exam.  You're also allowed cheat sheets on the exams as well.
Very Helpful and learned a ton.
Chris is a GREAT professor... he makes class fun and easy.... not kidding easiest class at osu hands down

Class was a breeze! Really cool, laid back guy. Gives like 6 quizzes, 2 assignments, and 3 exams. NO FINAL! Allowed a "cheat sheet" on all the midterms. No way you can get lower than a B in this class if you try at all.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as challenging and demanding, particularly for a 200-level course, with many students finding her lectures and expectations excessively rigorous and her teaching style off-putting. Reviews consistently highlight her moodiness, condescension, and tendency to argue with students over minor points, leading some to advise against taking her classes unless absolutely necessary.

Ratings.comment: Wow, talk about a joke of a class. Read a newspaper, did my taxes during each class, and got an easy A. Dont't buy the book, just use the class notes. Do the ricky bobby.

Definitely agree with previous posters. She is very moody and condescending and expects A LOT from a 200 level course class! Even though she tells you from rip its a little challenging, you think if you came to class and took notes from her slides, you'd be okay. Just too much material. Take it with another professor!

This class requires readings for every class, accompanied with a summary of the readings. If you're not interested in Urban social theory, do not take this class. Most of the class is discussion. The exams are take home essay questions, not too difficult if you understood the readings. Didn't read? Fail! She's nice.

She is the worst teacher i have ever had.  She argues with students over stupid things, and expects the students to retain WAY too much info for a 200 level class.  Compared to my other friends that took GEO 200 they said what she requires students to do was wayyyy more than their professors.  DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HER CLASSES

DO NOT TAKE THIS LADY. I am not even sure if she is trying to teach GEOG 200 or GEOG 520. RUDE to students, NEVER post up grades online so you have no idea what grade you are getting until the end of the quarter. WANNA DO GOOD IN GEOG 200? THEN DO NOT TAKE THIS LADY IF YOU JUST WANT TO TAKE GEOG 200 TO FULFILL GEC REQUIRMENTS
Tammy makes you responsible for SO much information it is IMPOSSIBLE to retain. Geography 200 is NOT curved & NOT easy & quite frankly Tammy is a ****. Prepare to fail the final.
Not the easiest professor in the world and likes to go off on unrelated tangents sometimes...

tammy mott was a foxy lady. her ta scott always kept the class interesting. however, she rambles on and just gets in fights with students that last an hour. you have to go to class. if you dont study for the tests, plan on failing because they are 80% of your grade.
A very well structured class.  She knows what she is talking about.

This was a pretty cool class, although be prepared to do some serious work.  The movies you watch are also very interesting...overall it's a good class, 10 page paper at the end was a little challenging.
Lots of work, but Tammy is a good professor.  I really learned a lot.  I would rec. taking her for Soc. 597

On the first day of class she tells you it will be hard, SHES NOT LYING, hard to stay awake.  Her lectures consist of her usually giving you notes which she basically reads off the comp. then discusses something that ends up having to do with religion and arguing with students.  SHE IS EXTREMELY COCKY!!! Exams were fairly hard.

She is very interested in and passionate about what she teaches; I hate geography and took it as a GEC and I ended up almost liking it.  It's not just a bunch of facts and maps, there's a lot of emphasis on current events and the way the world is changing. The exams questions come directly from her lectures and one of the two text books: easy.
This professor knows the subject and she expects attendance and participation.

The class was pretty difficult, but the notes she gave wew very helpful.  A really good teacher, but insanely moody!  She would yell at students who walked into class a couple minutes late some days, then other days she would be really nice and funny.  she really likes the students who participate in class

wonderful teacher. knew what she was talking about and if she didn't know something she didn't pretend like she knew all about it like some other professors. I wasn't interested in geography at all before I took her class and now its my major!

This is a hard class, but she tells you that from the beginning. She also tells you this is not a "locate x on the map" class. With that being said, be prepared to deal with constant mood swings. She was constantly yelling at her T.A. for things that should have been discussed before class and this is not acceptable behavior from a professional.

She was an awesome teacher, really knows her stuff, and it isn't really a hard class. You need to go to lecture, pay attention, and study a little, but tests are all very straight forward. I didn't read the book at all, there's like 6 questions "from" the book, use reasoning and you're fine.

Great Class! I learned a ton. Yeah it is a lot of information, but if your not in college to study then what are you doing here? I've heard her be called "cocky" but I would certainly rather be taught by someone who knows what she is talking about, than by someone who makes it up as she goes along. Don't bother buying the book, go to class instead!
I really enjoyed this class.  It was boring at times, but still really interesting material.  I totally recommend taking her!  She's really straight forward, but also a sweetheart.

This class was okay.  It had it's interesting points, but I found it hard to stay awake.  Focuses on the economic, social, political, etc. issues of the world.  Tests are okay if you study alot.  It's not your easy A or your blowoff class though.

Lots of content to study, to be sure, but I've never learned so much in my life. This isn't your typical "Find X Country" geography class. This is cultural geography that everyone should know. How civilizations form, topography, economics and sociology, wars. Absolutely fascinating stuff that not enough of us have a clue about! Highly recommended.
BAD CLASS........... she gives WAY to much information for a 200 level class... She knows her stuff but is too cocky about it!!!! Very ****y to you if you need to leave class early.....

I thought she was pretty cool. but i like geography. her TA was cool and helpfull as well. overall i just enjoyed attending this class as well as taking the tests... you do have to spend a good deal of time studying though
I really LIKED Tammy Mott. Her class is challenging, but she was VERY helpful and very fair. She is a well informed teacher, and is very interested in teaching a non-biase class.

This teacher is an absolute travesty.  She just recieved her doctorate and thinks she knows everything.  No silver spoon, sheltered child from Bexley should ever be allowed to teach a class dealing with global perspectives.  Do not take this teacher.
This psycho **** from hell is hard! She took a 200 class and made it a 410 level course. She's most apathetic to questions and requests for help. She made my first college quarter a sour experience.

she gives you all of the notes and possible material that could be on the test.  I didnt even buy the text book and pulled out an A-.  You still have to do quite a bit of studying though.  She is very helpful though I didnt seek any help.  Definitely take her

Beware. The class is pretty hard and boring to boot.  Tammy talks in a monotone voice, which doesnt help.  And so much work for the class.  material is interesting, but be prepared to work hard for your grade. exams are a b*tch
Seems like she knows what she is talking about very well but made the class much harder than most of the other geography 200 classes from what I heard
No Comments

Her class was very difficult.Im not gonna lie. But you can def tell she knows what she is talking about. She expects ALOT from her students. Alot of notes and print outs and maps. Dont miss class!!  She was very helpful and liked those students who participated in class regularly..Dont take this unless you're up for a good challenge!
This woman was a nightmare and I dropped her class for the first time in my 4 years of college. Unacceptable attitude toward students and busywork.

This lady is ridiculous! My friends said geography was easy...not if you take it with this lady! She made us write an 8 page paper and gave the most notes I've ever seen. The only good thing about her is that she knows what she's talking about except it's way too much info for a GEC class...all i wanted to do was locate places!
No Comments
No Comments
interested in geography and really hot

summary_comment: Professor Lewis is highly regarded for his engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, which transforms students' perspectives on geography beyond mere memorization of maps and facts. His classes are challenging and require significant effort, particularly due to extensive reading, but they are also highly informative and entertaining. Students recommend his class for its depth of knowledge and current event relevance, despite its demanding nature.

Ratings.comment: Professor Lewis is a great teacher. I thought geography was just learning maps and useless facts about countries, but he brings it into a new prospective. You will learn a TON of new info. Although he does stress his "political agenda" he does keep it fair and does say that it is just his opinion. Highly recommend.
The best class I've ever taken. It was not easy but I did learn a great deal and Lewis is very enthusiastic about the material. I ended up switching to a geography major because of this one class!

Take the Geog200 class with this guy. He's very knowledgeable about the subject, and you'll learn more than names and places. It's all so interesting! There is a lot to know and study about but if you're really eager about this topic you won't be sorry that you took his class.
