Took what I thought was going to be a boring class and made it very interesting. This was an 8 AM class, but he was usually pretty hyped up to teach. He wanders around the room and sometimes yells, just to get a reaction. Funny guy, though.

changed the way i think of geography, it's not just memorizing countries and maps. professor lewis is very interesting and energetic, bordering on goofy sometimes. a lot better version of this class than the one my roomate took.
Tough class and he's a strict grader.  Lots of reading that is required, too much.  He has great enthusiasm and is happy to teach and help when needed.
Extremely knowledgeable and interested in the subject matter. Dreamy in a nerdy kind of way.  I would definitely recommend this class to anyone interested in world politics or political geography.

very enthusiastic about the subject, makes it very entertaining. interesting topics, very big into current events and not afraid to speak his mind, though i'm sure alot of people disagree with him. makes a point to say that his way is not the only way to think of things, though. can be very complex and a lot of work.

very intelligent, articulate, and interesting prof. has high demands for students, but if you put in the work you get a lot out of the course. really very interesting material, covering everything from wal-mart to terrorism, and he finds a way to connect it all. definitely a great class and great instructor!

hard class and tough grader. expects people to read all of the readings and come to every class and you still have to fight for points. obvoiously knows a lot about the subjet but expects students to learn everything -- like we dont have other classes???! is very picky about writing, too... the guy's a grammar nazi
this guy is great.
He was a guest speaker in our class and lectured on the middle east. Enthusiastic and knowledgable, but a LOT of info to write down.

He was the TA for Professor Robbins and lectured a couple times, but was pretty good. He was VERY helpful outside of lecture and willing to go over tests and clarify imporant concepts. Because of his help I DEFINITELY got a better grade in the class. VERY smart and knows the material.

summary_comment: Ryan is a dedicated and caring professor who ensures students understand the material, though his classes can be long and sometimes boring. His exams are generally fair and do not require extensive preparation beyond attending lectures and reviewing PowerPoint notes provided online. Students appreciate his effort to engage and keep them interested in the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Not very hard if you come to class and look over the book. The exams are multiple choice and not very hard. He is a good professor but the classes are long and boring.

Boring!!!!  Made weather totally boring.  For a 100 level course it was far too detailed.  Three exams were o.k. The labs are a waste of time.  OSU could do so much better with this topic.  If you can take the class from someone other than Ryan, do it.
A really nice guy.
He cares!!! Take the class,Go to class. Not going to class Honks him OFF!Had a little curve, but  not much of one because he is a  GREAT TEACHER!!!And you don't need a curve to pass his class!!!
I had Ryan in the evening. Ryan seems nice, however he is not very interesting. Mostly reads off a powerpoint that he provides over carmen. No need to attend class, except for lab.
Nice guy. Midterms are fairly easy. Gives huge curve at end because he includes people with 0% in the curve.

i highly recommend ryan's class...the tests are a little tricky, so you really need to know the material, but the material is easy...it's all from the powerpoint notes he puts on carmen...and it doesn't hurt that he's hot!  :)

I truly enjoyed this class.  I was not interested in this class prior to taking it, but I am glad that I did with Ryan.  He is interesting and kept my attention.  I would recommend this class to anyone.
What a joke!  The only professor that could possibly make weather boring!  An A on all 8 of my labs, and he failed me!  Thankfully he won't be teaching the class in fall and I can make it up!
No Comments

summary_comment: Austin is highly regarded as a dedicated and engaging professor who genuinely cares about his students' understanding and interest in the subject matter. He is known for his approachable nature and willingness to help both in and out of class, although some students note that he may not be as readily available for extra help compared to other instructors. His classes are generally considered easy and enjoyable, with assignments that are meaningful and beneficial rather than burdensome.

Ratings.comment: Wish some of us had a different professor
Not eager to help.

Austin was the best professor I've had at OSU. He found a way to create an interest in a topic no matter your background. He was quick to reply to any questions through emails, and gave great feedback on exams. Kocher is also a very helpful resource for career field choices.

He is the best. We did not get though half the syllabus (not complaining). He really cares about the subject matter and students. Not a very demanding class but you have to attend class to do well because we are tested over our in class group discussions. He asks us our opinions on what we want to learn and do. wants to help us in and out of class

World Reg. Geography: Austin is the best college professor I've had in three years of classes.  He's a PhD student, so he knows what being a student is like, and I think he structures the class in a way that adds work for the student, but isn't a burden.  The work he does assign is only assigned because it is beneficial, not pointless busy work.
Austin is a good guy, young so he's easy to talk to, knows and loves what he's teaching. Definitely held my interest. Don't skip lectures.

Super easy teacher and an enjoyable class. I disliked him at first ( I thought he was a total yuppie), but he definitely wore on me! I learned a great deal in the class without stressing too much about my grade.  My only complaint is that we didn't really cover any individual regions in a "world regional geography" class. I still learned a lot!

Very good professor in OSU. Interesting to take his class and very helpful for me to understand regional geography. You will definitely  get a good grade if you pay attention to homework and discussion in class.
Cool dude. A guy you would want to go to a bar with. Loves what he teaches and clearly cares about students. You have to go to class and pay attention and then you will do fine. Take him!

I love this guy! Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had at OSU. He's interested in the material and very well knowledge about what he's teaching. I found it nice that he also had these mini stories about the different regions he taught about. Great professor, I wish he taught another class.

Mr. Kocher is very personable, laid back, and passionate about what he teaches. His class gives you a broad understanding of global geography (extremely interesting if you like to travel, like me) and is a stress-free way to earn a couple of credit hours.

He was really nice and helpful. He wants his students to do well. I liked the way he taught the class. It was easy and he gave a few quizzes instead of midterms. He knew what he was talking about and talked about a lot of interesting experiences he had too which made the class more engaging. Overall great guy; I would take another class with him.

Great teacher to have for Geography 200. He knows his stuff when he teaches you geography and tries his best to go outside the textbook and keep you informed on relevant topics in geography. If you attend class and pay attention to his class, it is an easy A. Overall, great guy who understands that a GEC shouldn't burden a student's life with work.

a cool teacher and easy class. knows what he is talking about and has a diverse background that he incorporates into his teaching. understands its a gec and doesnt try to burden you with the class. you dont use the textbook much, its more of a reference for the online discussions and other assignments. you will do well if you just pay attention.

summary_comment: The professor is described as a nice individual but has been criticized for delivering monotonous lectures that were difficult for some students to follow. Despite this, the exams tend to closely mirror the lecture content, making them more manageable for students.

Ratings.comment: Nice guy. Everything in the class sounded the same to me, so the class was ruff for me. But exams are mostly lectured based.

summary_comment: Based on student comments, this professor's class is considered the worst in terms of teaching quality, with students finding it highly unsatisfactory.

Ratings.comment: The worst class I've ever taken in my life.

summary_comment: Dr. Law is highly regarded for her engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, which makes lectures easy to follow and participate in. Students appreciate her passion for the subject matter and find her classes valuable, often noting that they change their perspective on the topic. However, some students feel that she can be forceful in imposing her opinions and that the lack of a textbook sometimes leads to disjointed learning.

Ratings.comment: How is this woman considered a good teacher? She doesn't teach. She forces you to adopt her opinion.

Dr. Law is very engaging, and her lectures are easy to listen to and take notes on (she draws on the board a lot and tells you what you need to know).  Her tests are not rough, but she will grade you fairly. Lots of readings, but they are interesting, relevant, and not too time consuming. Also, she is a great person to get to know!

My favorite professor at Denison thus far. I learned so much from Dr. Law this year, and I actually loved going to class, despite the early time. She's really knowledgeable and energetic, and I've never felt more comfortable participating in class!
She teaches at Denison now. Super super into the subject and really enthusiastic. She's fabulous.

As long as you keep up with the readings ( a broad knowledge of them) you'll do fine.  She has pop reading quizzes that go into your attendance grades.  Exams were exactly the notes, so do attend lecture and overall she's enthusiastic.

Justine is very nice & always enthusiastic. Even though it was cool to not have a textbook, it would've been nice to have something to reenforce lecture material. The assigned readings feel like stories with sparse info and a waste of time to read. Also, she's not really open to viewpoints that differ from her own.
this class is the reason why i added a geography minor

Professor Law is great. She is so passionate about the class which rubs off to most of the students. She is one of those professors that change the way you view the world and that is the true essence of university and education. Do yourself a favor and take a class with her.

One of the best professors I've had at OSU. I didn't like the topic of the class, but she made it genuinely interesting. She's always so delightful. Also exceptionally helpful and understanding. The class isn't a breeze though, takes some studying.
Of all the instructors I've had in all of the classes I've taken, Justine is the best. She really cares and she shows up everyday with a smile and is excited to help us learn

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as unprofessional and disorganized, with lectures becoming repetitive and unengaging after the first exam. Students found her overly critical and disruptive in class, and her teaching methods, while passionate in some cases, were often confusing and poorly planned. Additionally, there were complaints about her focus on irrelevant topics and political biases influencing the course content.

Ratings.comment: The lectures after the first exam took place became pointless as she doesn't even give a final. She calls out students in class very unprofessionally for trivial things like smiling or yawning. Repetitively asks "Are you with me?". Felt like a 7th grade Environmental Science class yet less well-planned out.

Sayoni was my lab instructor for Geography 2800 "Our Global Environment". She was very passionate about what she was teaching but was not very good at teaching it. Her lab assignments were confusing and her thick accent often times made it hard to hear her. Although the in class assignments were graded lightly, written assignments were not.

The class itself is easy but 100% of the time she prints different directions on activities than she actually wants you to do. Then she wastes half the class explaining her new directions. She also uses personal issues as an excuse for moody behavior. Not professional.

First off,she is a grad student,not an experienced professor.I didnt need a textbook,and all notes were provided on carmen,and I barely had to fill in any notes of my own they were so thorough.She focuses too much on politics,not enough on physical geography or culture.Exams were 70% writing 30% mult choice.Keep up and Memorize the notes for easy A
i actually liked the class even it was boring at times, i still enjoyed it, its very easy course to pass, and notes were provided. it opened my mind to a new perspective. she is a great instructor :)

Really frustrating class. Beyond boring and I have an interest in geography. ALSO, if you are a republican you will want to rip your hair out. She slams Fox News all the time and made one of the most idiotic remarks ever about the Iraq war and Dick Cheney. Avoid if possible

She generally seemed somewhat unqualified for the job and unorganized.  The class was extremely boring because she tended to ramble on about minute details. This boredom was significant considering that I'm a geography minor.  There was no syllabus for any of the projects or exams, which made the class harder than it needed to be.

This teacher makes world geography hard or confusing? This professor is horrible...had a 5 page paper..a midterm over 40 pages of notes and homework/quizzes every class. She does not specify what is on midterm...just says  short answers ..essays ..medium answers and mult. choice over notes. Can barely understand her...trust me it is ridiculous

A slow paced, very boring class. The information was not interesting, and the lectures often felt muddled. It could be hard to understand her sometimes and she didn't always speak up. Note taking was easy as notes were provided online and minimal additions were needed in class. Homework was limited and easy. Would not recommend taking this class

summary_comment: This professor is known for delivering a well-structured and manageable course, allowing students to achieve easy A's with relatively little difficulty. The class is considered not too challenging, making it accessible for most students.

Ratings.comment: he is a good professor. the class was not too hard. I took it as easy A and  i got it.

summary_comment: Michael is a highly engaging and humorous professor who genuinely cares about his students' success. While his class relies heavily on exams, particularly the midterm and final, which can be challenging, he provides ample resources and is known for his supportive and entertaining teaching style. Students recommend taking his classes due to his positive impact and dedication.

Ratings.comment: Michael evidently cares a lot about his students--he makes an effort to get to know them during class and wants as many people to succeed as possible. His class is not hard if you try on recitation assignments and study for the midterm. No final exam, only a final project. Would definitely take another class with him. He's also hilarious
Very stick with test and finals.Usually final paper is given full grades, but he reads very carefully with paper.

Avoid him. Yes his assignments other than the exams are easy, but the exams are pretty hard.The exams make up 55% of your grade. The average for my classes first exam was a 70%. That is horrible in my opinion for a GEC class. No book and his powerpoint lectures only contain outlines of the information he wants you to know. Worst GEC I have taken.

Puts powerpoints, the entire vocab list, and all the readings & videos online, and lecture usually includes a few entertaining examples or references to general (or his) life adages/stories the way he tells them. Study hard around midterm & final time, those are long.

No textbook-huge plus! His lectures are pretty interesting, and he definitely has a sarcastic sense of humor. I had no trouble in his class, although many of my classmates did. As long as you go to class, take notes, and study for the exams it was a fairly easy A. You can get extra credit by eating at an ethnic restaurant too!

The material for this class isn't very interesting, but Michael makes class fun. He is hilarious and tells a lot of jokes and plays music before class. No textbook required, just online readings. Tests were somewhat difficult but overall not too bad, I managed an A- in the class so it wasn't overly difficult. Only 3 assignments during the quarter.

He is a very nice and funny guy. No textbook, so it requires you to get the info from his lectures, but he entertains enough and is relaxed so I've never dreaded going to his class. Assignments aren't too bad, but tests(mainly the final) was hard. Def reccommend him, take his classes! You can tell he likes what he is teaching.  Great professor!
Michael is a great teacher. He's hilarious, interesting, and really helpful, especially at office hours. Swears constantly and plays music before class. Assignments are fun, but tests are very hard.
He teaches well. I understand things in class and Dont have to go home and study at all so he is Very good. He is entertaining too.
The material is pretty boring but Michael makes class interesting. Tells a lot of jokes in class, doesn't take attendance, no textbook. Exams are really tough but he gives lots of extra credit.

summary_comment: Professor Cox is highly knowledgeable and often humorous, though his lectures can be confusing due to tangents and disorganized slides. Students find the class manageable with good attendance and effort, and it offers ample extra credit opportunities. However, some students struggle with the material and exams, emphasizing the importance of active engagement and preparation.

Ratings.comment: Professor Cox is extremely knowledgeable, and although he sometimes distracts himself from his main points with tangents, he gets the material across. Really funny if you give him a chance. Overall, not a very hard class, tests are very easy if you put any time at all in and plenty of extra credit opportunities.

Overall, Mr. Cox is a really nice guy but his lecture is pretty much confusing. His slides are not well organized. Sometimes just few pictures or graphs showed. He teaches the world region geography totally not in the tradition way which is so interesting. By the way, there are just 4 tests, no homework.

I agree that the man is smart and shares some great insight. BUT, he is difficult to follow largely due to his rants and tangents which are unrelated to required knowledge. I attended every class, took notes frequently, studied hard and got C's on midterms. As basic as the content is and with a diligent effort, this should be an easy A, it's not.

Great guy with lots of enthusiasm for the course. He is very funny with his references of life experiances and Monty Python jokes. Lectures are long but interesting, he is very knowledgable on the material. Overall solid class.

Worst class ever. This is not an easy A. You have to go to class and pay attention to try and figure out what he wants you to know. Exams and quizzes take up 96% of your grade so you better pay attention and study hard.

Great professor. He is an extremely intelligent man and has a lot of interesting insights to share. If you go to class, you will do fine. I don't know why there are so many negative reviews of him. He is one of the best professors I've had at OSU.

I thought he was hilarious! That made the class fun and interesting. Yea he was condescending at times and very blunt, but that was part of his British humor. Material was interesting and super easy if you go to class. No essays!

Not as bad as most of these reviews make him out to be. He is very blunt and can come off as condescending sometimes. He is helpful if you go up and ask him questions personally. He also puts quiz/midterm questions online beforehand and answers questions. If you don't pay attention and read, this class will be rough.
Worst professor I've had at OSU. Attending class is mandatory yet he wastes class time trying to be funny and rambling on while recklessly navigating through his pointless powerpoints. Avoid him.

I really enjoyed his class. He was interesting to listen to but at times it was boring. His tests are pretty tough but if you go to class and do the study guide you'll do great because it's pretty much the same questions. I didn't think he was as bad as what others think on here.

By far the worst professor I have ever had! The material is absolutely useless and non-sensical and can be summed up in a page rather than 40. He is rude and arrogant. He seems like a very knowledgeable person but he cannot teach. I'd rather swim with sharks then to take one of his classes again, pure hell!

All he talks about is his memories and then when the exam comes he butchers you be careful of this professor might seem like an easy class but he looks for extremely small details in his exams and if you dont get the whole answer right then he marks it wrong...could have recieved an A in the class if he wasn't such a harsh grader

His book is interesting (case studies especially) but lectures are unbearable... Attendance is 4% of grade and you can only miss 3 lectures. 2 quizzes, midterm and final. His study guides (w/ answers) basically cover everything on the test so the class is an easy A if you get the attendance pts and study minimally
This prof. is really good at making the straightforward more complex.
He is one the most condecending teachers ive ever experienced at OSU.  Im not paying top dollars at OSU just to be disrespected.  Do not take this dude for any class.  You will be angry will him.

Its sad when professors who are brilliant and can potentially make classes awesome, do the exact opposite.  He is one of the worst ive had at OSU.  He talks about what he wants 2 talk about in lectures, not relative things to your grades. EXTREMELY DISRESPECTFUL TO STUDENTS, even ones who attend class every day and try their best.  AWFUL PROFESSOR.
he gave us all of the questions and all of the answers for exams and quizzes beforehand (although, somehow people still failed). the class was easy and fun.

Dr. Cox grades for specific details on his exams. There made up of mostly long answer questions so you need to know alot of little details. We didnt cover much information, but require you know sometimes stupid details. No book is provided you to read his notes, which consist of alot of fluff and not a whole lot of meaningful informmation.

Professor Cox was never helpful, graded way too hard and his teaching style was very vague while his tests were very specific. I took his intro to Globalization class- i recommend reading the book in the beginning rather than the end when it is assigned. I also think he is very disrespectful.

Not a bad guy, but he's really particular on the exams. He gives you most of the answers before the test though so you just need to make sure you prepare and know EVERYTHING! The TA was not helpful at all. He was very condescending.

The tests are really difficult. He looks for really specific answers, and if you don't have them, he's rough. Cox tries to be nice and funny, but people in my class were just frustrated with his teaching and grading style. I wouldn't advise taking him.

Dr. Cox is extremely knowledgeable about the subject.  His British humor livens up the otherwise boring lecture.  He tends to look at the topic very philosophically, so he can be a little incomprehensible at times.  Go to class and read the case study examples in his book (that's where he draws most of his questions). 2 quizzes, midterm, and final.

Holds an interesting perspective, but seems to take it at a dogmatic approach, which reflects in his textbook he wrote for the class. I guess he is an honored professor at OSU, but I had trouble learning from him. He doesn't proof read his tests and does not give much time to take them either. The only positive aspect of class were the discussions.
I really enjoyed the class, he is very clear on subjects;however, quizes and midterms are a bit hard. He knows the stuff well, and he really seems to enjoy teaching.

Lectures are incredibly boring. He tries to spice them up with his British humor, and makes it as bearable as possible. He's British, and always makes jokes at the expense of the French. He often repeats himself in class, but the exams are based more on the text anyway. The book is a TERRIBLY tedious read. Easy overall, though, and a fun prof.

This class is miserable but Dr. Cox is highly entertaining and a really nice guy. He goes out of his way to get to know his students. Class seems hard because his lectures meander but all the material is right out of the book so it's not like you really miss anything. He tends to take test questions from the footnotes and sidebars and the texts.
Good

This class both good and bad. Kevin is a good professor and he makes the material interesting, plus he likes to tell a lot of jokes which can be fun. Problems with the class though are he has horrible grammar, questions on quizes/midterms aren't clear, and for some reason he won't post lecture notes online, so if you miss a class, you miss a lot.

Professor Cox is extremely informative has a passion about whats he teaching. BUT the class is basically reading stories and providing an analysis. If you do not answer his questions precisely your grade will suffer  tremendously ..   . The guy is hilarous though! constantly making jokes ! Great Guy!

I think it is important that people realize Dr. Cox is a renowned expert in Marxism and historical materialism. True, his writing lacks basic grammar rules (commas esp), but it would be a mistake to dismiss him.

He was an incredible professor. While his tests were worded oddly at times and the material difficult, he was sincerely interested in seeing the students succeed and helping us understand! It was one of the most dynamic courses I've taken.

nice guy, makes funny faces when lecturing, exams weren't hard at all if you go to class and read the modules on his website...don't bother with the course pack, he was very fair if you talked to him about a misunderstanding about a question, I would take his class again
I enjoyed his take on world situations, but I did have to argue to get some points back on his poorly worded quizes.  Don't avoid his classes, just grow some balls you pussies.
No Comments

This guy needs to take an English 110 class! Every exam, quiz, or module contained either a gramatical error! He needs to learn what a run on sentence is and is very slow in explaining his point. I don't understand why we have to take this class for IS, when it's a glorified world history class. The history department does a much better job!

Contrary to most of the comments posted here, I think Prof. Cox is pretty great.  He has a great sense of humor and knows his bits.  The tests were not hard if you came to lecture or read the modules.  I was deterred by the comments posted on here, but found them to be wrong.
Kevin is great. He knows his stuff and teaches well. He is extremely helpful.

He was one of the better professors I had at Ohio State.  He was opinionated, but if you presented an idea and backed it up, he would give credit for that, even if he disagreed.  I consider him a friend and he pushed me to get my degree when I thought I couldn't do it.  Professors are like food: everyone has their own taste and I personally like this guy.

If you have to take this course, you better hope he retires before you get there. The tests made no sense, and we always had to argue to get points back. I've never had a prof. that was this bad and disorganized!!!

IS majors beware...wait to take this class when another prof is teaching!! This guy is horrible.  He tries to brainwash you with his ignorant opinions rather than base anything off of actual scholarship.  Almost half the class dropped, and this is a GEOGRAPHY course!
Kevin Cox actually told me to "take that form and shove it up your ass."  I will never forget this pompous, bitter man and his teaching style.
DON'T DO IT!! It is the 6th week and people are dropping like flys. The test make no sence and half the class is failing.
No Comments

summary_comment: Jeff is a passionate professor who expects significant effort from students, assigning extensive readings and requiring thoughtful participation. While some find his lectures challenging and his teaching style not always effective, others appreciate his enthusiasm and the stimulating nature of the course material. Overall, his teaching quality is mixed, with some students finding him helpful and engaging, while others struggle with the workload and delivery.

Ratings.comment: This was a hard class, but I thought Jeff did a good job of outlining main concepts in class (attendance isn't required but it was helpful to go!). You definitely have to put in some time studying and reading outside of class, but overall I thought the subject was thought provoking and an interesting science GE

I'll break down this class as objective as possible:  You have 5 grades all semester (2 midterms, a participation grade, a paper, a presentation, and a final). Readings are assigned every week >15 pages with a written response of at least 250 words. Exams are tough and wordy. t Participation grade given out last week. Personal opinion: Hated it.

No idea what the person below is talking about. Obviously didn't like their grade on one of the exams. Mr. Lafrenniere is passionate and it's obvious he cares a great deal about his students. He does expect you to work and to think and to participate, but that's what college is about. And 17 pages per reading is too much? Seriously???

Intelligent and passionate about climate change but just a terrible teacher. His passion doesn't really translate well in class and his lectures are useless. Readings are at least 17 pages each, usually 2 or more per class, way too much for a GE. Don't take this class if you need a science GE.
Although super passionate about what he teaches, he talks too fast, his study guides and lecture "notes" are terrible, and he's constantly out of town.
Extremely helpful and was an awesome TA. Always fair and clear. One of the better TA's I've ever had
Awesome GA! Very helpful, kind of funny too. I also highly recommend the class. It's not that easy but it's interesting

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as poorly organized and unqualified to teach the course, with frequent errors in tests and quizzes. Students find his lectures and notes disorganized and often confusing, and many warn to avoid the class entirely. While some note that the class is relatively easy due to posted materials and opportunities for extra credit, the overall consensus is negative, citing issues with clarity, organization, and the professor's demeanor.

Ratings.comment: He is not qualified to teach this GEC. Every test/quiz had some sort of error on it. He makes the class fair and gives a decent amount of extra credit, but it's just really obnoxious how many mistakes there are.

So disorganized.  The notes are disorganized and not really helpful.  The book is expensive and useless.  His notes had concepts that weren't explained, and were not in the book.  He is rude sometimes, getting snarky when people are late.  He doesn't allow people to go to the bathroom.  He has the phd god complex going on.  Don't take this class!
Avoid at all costs. Box is a completely useless teacher.

I would say this class was extremely disorganized. The fact that no book was used only increased that problem. Slides were posted online, however so were readings & the links were only correct half the time. Unless you know a lot about geography it will be tough- the tests are made to trick you- the midterm average was a C- & no points were added.

This was one of the worst classes I've ever had. At times down right rude, seemed to be constantly at a loss for an answer. There was a serious expectation to have some prior knowledge before taking his course which is always frustrating and places one at an even greater disadvantage. I would recommend him only if geography was a sincere interest.
Consistently seems to second guess himself during lecture and seems very unprepared.  Overall it is an easy class; he posts all the powerpoint lectures online which is helpful.
He is not helpful at all. Expects you to know things even if you have never learned that topic before. Be prepared to do IDL!!

The course started off slow and disorganized, but got better. Still, there were quite a few times when he would ask the class if his notes were right. Review sheets covered almost everything you needed.  Also, if you know IDL or can pick up programming languages easily, you're almost guaranteed an A. He gives EC for doing the homeworks in IDL.
No Comments

this class was applicable and thought-provoking. lectures tended to be a little long at times, but learn the material b/c it is very useful and may change the way you think about our world, environment, culture, etc. Study guide given out before the test- helped for the most part. Prof. Box has a nice sense of humor and is into the subject.
No Comments
Unorganized, more interested in his research than in his students.  Very dry lectures, not helpful.  Unfortunately, he is the only teacher for 622, which is a requirement for AS students.
horrible horrible teacher

summary_comment: Professor Bromwich is an accomplished researcher with deep knowledge of global warming but struggles with teaching effectiveness. Students found him disengaged from class, often absent, and more focused on his research than on instruction. His grading was perceived as harsh, and he struggled to explain concepts clearly to non-science majors.

Ratings.comment: Was completely obsessed with global warming and didn't have much knowledge on other subjects. Couldn't always answer student questions. More interested in his own global warming research than teaching class. Wasn't even there for 1/3 of classes. TA seemed more knowledgeable. Rough grading on homework
He really knew what he was talking about, but had a hard time "dumbing it down" to mostly non-science people. Grading was a little harsh.

Mainly, he didn't want to be there. All we heard about was his research and trips to Antartica and is review had nothing to do with the tests. The TA graded ridiculously according to what Dr. Bromwich specified. (i.e. taught sig digits but did not encorporate into grading). Avoid if possible, his substitute Grad Student was way better.

Prof. Bromwich is an accomplished researcher, but  is not enthusiastic about teaching.  He needs to have higher expectations of his students.  He also needs to vary his teaching methods beyond reading from lecture notes on an overhead projector and encourage more class participation.

summary_comment: Peter is an excellent professor known for his deep knowledge of the subject matter and his willingness to assist students. He is highly recommended and appreciated for being both approachable and helpful.

Ratings.comment: Peter did a great job with the class. Highly recommended. Really knows his stuff, and always willing to help.
Peter is a nice guy. He is very approachable and helpful.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as one of the best at OSU due to their helpfulness and interesting content, though some find them challenging to understand and not effective at teaching. Despite being described as knowledgeable and approachable, many students feel they learn little from the classes and rely heavily on external resources. Overall, while the professor is appreciated for their personality and potential knowledge, their teaching methods are often criticized for being ineffective.

Ratings.comment: Easiest professor I have ever had. I went to class five times this semester to turn assignments in. Got and A. Learned absolutely nothing.
Really nice and helpful guy
One of the best professors in osu!

I don't think it is his accent that makes him hard to understand, rather the way he rattles on and on about something unimportant, that never relates to anything in the course. Nice guy, but babbles. A lot! Terrible teaching. He is very smart, and I believe he knows his material, I just think he hit his prime about 28 years ago...Throw in the towel

A great time. Extremely interesting, although very difficult to understand. Great, nice guy but doesn't really teach at all. Tests aren't difficult at all as long as you adhere to study guide. I had fun.

This professor is almost impossible to understand, the class sessions are pointless because all of the material can be learned at home a week before the exams. The review guides, tests and assignments are written with terrible grammer to the point it is impossible to understand what is being asked.
does anyone knows how to get a hold of the old exams?

Yes, the guy's old, Russian, and the class isn't all that interesting. And getting old exams/homework will make it a cakewalk. BUT doing that cakewalk-work is a quick trip to getting busted for cheated. 2 of my friends got put on academic probation... DON'T BE TEMPTED TO CHEAT in this class, just because you CAN.

He is very knowledgeable, but does not know how to engage a college student into being interested in the topic he teaches. Most, or all, of the readings/map/charts/etc are on carmen, so going to lecture is not necessary. Again, getting old tests will help you a lot

Unlike the rest of the class, I didn't cheat. I never went to class though - the professor was too difficult to understand and the material was presented very dryly. I did the readings on my own, did everything on my own, and got a B-. I wouldn't recommend the class.
the final was exactly the same as the old exams, and questions are in the same order.

During lecture, he teaches us to use the internet and carmen, along with reading to us. He's a nice man, but he is rather out of it. Buy or borrow old tests, do the 15 minute presentation, 4 take home assignments and you should at least get an B+

No need to go to class, lecture didn't help me at all. Take home map assignments and quizzes were easy, use the study guide for the exams. SG doesn't cover all the material but you can usually make an educated guess for the rest of the stuff. I ended up with an A and didn't even buy the book. Didn't know so many people had the old exams...

Don't take this class if you can't get old exams. You have to read A LOT of stuff in this class. And even you read everything, there is no guarantee to get a good grade. But if you can get old exams, take this class because exams will be super easy for you.

One of the worst teachers I've had since...dunno when.He's like your granpa, if he was Yoda and liked to drone on and on about how it was in the old country. I couldn't learn anything from him so I stopped going to class and still passed it. He really needs to retire.

Hmm..yeah, he's a nice guy.  Definitely not a nice class though. I'm not sure being "efficient" will sail you through the course with an A like the previous review implies. Anyway,it might as well be an online course..all you do is memorize a few hundred articles posted on carmen anyway, and of course do a couple map assignments,and a couple exams.

I think it is funny that last comment said the class was hard.  You must not be too efficient with you school work.  Yuri needs to retire, but nice guy nevertheless.  A lot of online copy-n-pasted notes.

I'm not sure why there are so many reviews saying this is an easy class-maybe if you cheat and have the old exams, like half of my class did. I didn't have old exams and struggled through with a C+. First C I ever got and this was my last quarter before graduation. He really needs to condense the info since there were only 26 quest. on the final!

The EASIEST class ever. The old man is too sweet, has a lot of funny stories, and yes, for a native speaker it is a little challenging to understand him. Just read his online lectures and you'll get an A.

Worst Class Ever! Couldn't understand a word the man said. He didn't use the textbook just posted articles on Carmen. This could basically be an internet class because no one comes to class anyway. The man should just retire.

Is probably the better of the two 597 profs. Attendance isn't counted, so you don't need to go. Take home quizzes and map assignments are a breeze. The paper is pretty easy as well. Overall, not as bad as people made it seem.
the class is so easy if you have the OLD exams and quizzes, because they're almost exactly the same. Don't go to class if you have the old exams and you'll get an A,.

I couldn't understand his lectures but overall he is very knowledeable about geography. Like the other comments, his stories are informative and funny at times. But the sad thing is that majority of the class didn't come to lectures.

He is extremely difficult to understand but try to listen... not because the material is difficult or even interesting but because his stories are HILARIOUS!  He was kicked out of Soviet Russia and he is very bitter about it!

the only thing i ever got out of lecture was a numb butt...most intelligible professor on osu campus...thick russian accent and speaks softly.  easy if you don't mind teaching yourself, he does post excessive number of articals so you can learn from home, exams both multiple choice, and take home quizs.take with someone else if can. a real headache

This guy doesnt care if you come to class, or even give the quizes and tests late - you dont even need an excuse - he'll give you an A. I gave the mid term right before the final exam, he let me work with my friend on the exam. if you want to get an A in the class, wait for the last day of class and steal the quizes and email him the answers

You can manage this class without actually attending the lectures. However M is a very cool professor lifewise and has alot of real life stories to tell!!! He is very understanding to students needs, although his lectures are long and sometimes dry, He has a sense of humor and knows his stuff.

This class is VERY EASY for a 500 level class.  However be prepared to NOT go to class as Medvedkov's lectures are VERY BORING and posts all his notes and test material online.I would NOT take this class if you want to actually learn but if you want an easy A with minimal brain activity TAKE THIS CLASS!
The worst experience in my entire OSU career.
Anyone know what the class is like?

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is low according to student feedback, as many find the class boring and often struggle to stay awake during lectures.

Ratings.comment: I have no interests in his class? always feel sleepy

summary_comment: Wei is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, particularly in GIS and computer programming. He sets clear expectations and goes above and beyond to assist students, making his labs both informative and engaging. Students consistently report significant learning gains under his guidance.

Ratings.comment: Wei is a rock star in the lab. He is very friendly and always nice to everyone. He is very knowledgeable in his subject matter especially GIS and computer programming. If you work hard with him, you will earn a lot from this guy.

Wei was extremely clear at what the expectations of the course were, and he was always willing to work out of his way to help students. The labs were very well written and got across many important ideas and techniques. I definitely learned a lot this quarter.

summary_comment: Dr. Hobgood is widely regarded as an excellent and passionate professor, known for his deep knowledge of the subject and ability to make lectures engaging. While some students find his exams challenging and his grading process slow, most appreciate his willingness to help and his genuine interest in student success. However, a few students have criticized his ambiguity in homework assignments and exams, suggesting a need for clearer communication and more lenient grading policies.

Ratings.comment: Never in my life have I had a professor who is more ambiguous with his homework assignments and exams than this professor. He is completely useless if you ask him for help via email or office hours with homework. On exams if you marginally screw up a calculation, and it carries over into subsequent problems, expect little credit. Just awful.

Dr. Hobgood was a great teacher.  He explained everything well, and was extremely passionate about the subject  He is extremely knowledgeable about his field.  Sometimes, his lectures could be boring, but if your taking the class based on your interests, that won't matter.
Best professor I have had. His exams can be tough, but if you work hard, you will get a good grade them. The homework assignments will help boost your grade though.

Dr. Hobgood is by far the best professor in the geography department. He does take awhile to grade assigments and midterms, but he genuinely loves to teach. He will help you in any way he can. He makes potentially boring lectures very fun.

Very helpful, practical, fun professor. Has a genuine interest in helping out students and will go out of his way to help students understand content. Loves what he teaches. Very open in office hours. His classes aren't that difficult, but this is largely in part due to how well he teaches and what he emphasizes.
Dr. Hobgood is an excelent teacher.

Dr. Hobgood is the best professor in the department. Having had each of the undergraduate professors at this point, he is hands down the best faculty member. Not only is he intelligent and helpful with class material, he shows a geniune interest in his students - not a puppet of material, but a mentor and by the end of the quarter, friend.
No Comments
Nice guy, pretty easy class.  Much easier than the math/physics pre-reqs.  Very clear in lectures, plus what he emphasizes in the homework and lectures is actually what gets emphasized on the exams.
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her enjoyable and kind teaching style, making the class relatively easy with take-home quizzes and minimal assignments. While the final and map quizzes are more challenging, students generally find the course manageable and rewarding, with many recommending her for her ability to boost grades through map quizzes and make the material engaging.

Ratings.comment: A very fun and kind teacher. Her class was very easy. Take home quizzes and one written assignment. Both final and midterm were during class time and were quite easy. If you take this class try to get her as a teacher.

the map quizzes were a great grade booster. the assignments weren't too bad and the take home quizzes each week were easy (everything was in the text). she tried to make the class fun and interesting.

She is a very nice female. Tries to make the class interesting. There is no mid term for the class and take home quizzes....I took it for this reason and got an A. I had taken another prof first but he sucked. Shes much better...but you will have to study a bit for the final. Assignments are not too hard. Map tests are ok... overall not very hard

Take home quizzes, No Mid-term, No long paper, only 2 Map Tests with 25 questions 1 bonus and a Final. French accent so it may be tough to understand. There are 2 written exercises, this class is great I just wish I didnt have it at 8 am.

summary_comment: Professor Davis' teaching style is inconsistent, with some students finding his lectures engaging and informative, while others describe them as overly detailed and boring. His class involves a significant amount of material, including weekly map quizzes that some find easy due to clear instructions, but others consider them hard and unnecessary. Overall, the class can be challenging due to the volume of content, though it can be managed with consistent study and attendance.

Ratings.comment: What a boring class. 95% of the information taught in lecture was not even on the exam. The weekly map quizzes were hard and useless. The guy was nice and friendly, but this class was awful. Put me to sleep everyday. Most of the class didn't pass. If you like to study like crazy, go ahead and take him.

Jason Davis was sort of an enjoyable lecturer for the most part, but I feel like he sort of made the Geography 200 class sort of more difficult than really necessary. To do well on the tests you sort of need to pay close attention and take good notes during lecture. He sort of says sort of a LOT... but it's sort of funny.

I liked his class! You can tell he really loves what he does, and he has an adorable awkward charm. As long as you go to class, the coursework is pretty painless. Notes are not online and you never use the book.
The class is not hard, but there is a great deal of material. That makes the class somewhat challenging. Weekly map quizzes are not difficult if you study. Papers are fairly easy.

I think this course would be great for anyone interested in the recent history behind world conflict.  Professor Davis does give a lot of dense notes in class, but if you want to learn about the subject material, you will.  He has a really good handle on what he is teaching.
Great class. He shares alot of little extra tidbits then works them into the exams to keep people on their toes.

This professor is easy. Class consists of 3 exams and 5 map quizes. Map quizzes are very easy cause he tells you everything that's on them plus he has a study guide for exams that has everything on the exam. The only difficult part is the quantity of material (lots of it). Bottem line-easy A if you study.

Seems like the class goes on forever.Map quizes every week are pretty easy points.The classes are notes the entire time(Doesnt hardly EVER let out early)and talks about 2340832 points that ARENT on his powerpoint..or midterms.the whole lecture is infected with worthless info and makes it hard to stay awake. He IS passionate i have to give him that.

Map quizzes every week (every Friday) memorize countries and cities and more in each continent. says "sort of" and "sort of like" between every word making it hard to listen to him and take in the information he lectures

summary_comment: Professor Nick is highly regarded for his enthusiastic and engaging teaching style, which makes complex topics accessible and interesting. Students appreciate his thorough coverage of relevant material and his availability during office hours. However, some find his lectures dense and the pacing challenging, with concerns about clarity and relevance of the content presented.

Ratings.comment: I just got my grade for this course, did alright and I'm okay with the grade. I REALLY liked the course! Nick showed me a kind of geography I didn't know existed. I'm not planning to change my major or anything, but I'll definitely take another course with him if I have a chance.

I'm taking Economic and Social Geography with Nick right now, it's great! I had no idea this was what geography would be like!! Lots of connections to my other classes, cool readings (tough sometimes), engaging lectures, really really good movies. Def take this class if you're looking for a GEC

Nick was super enthusiastic, and he made class interesting. He always drew on new material but brought lecture back to the main ideas from the first weeks of class. There was no textbook, which was nice... he gave us all the readings as PDFs, so it was cheap for us. Helpful in office hours too.

Even though it's introductory, the class is ambitious. I initially found the class difficult, but it was well carried out. I hadn't taken geography before, so I didn't know what to expect, but I really enjoyed it. Nick was VERY generous during his office hours, and he guided me in how to do better than I did at first. Take this class with him!

At first, its hard to follow a lot of the material since the class isn't exactly chronological. In the end, I felt I had much better background in understanding why our world is set up in the way that it is today. He did spend too much time going off on trivial issues, still quizzes, tests and the one essay were more than appropriate and fair.

The content of this class is pretty much just silly.This guy and what he teaches are just long-winded nonsense. He spends an entire class talking about something he could sum up in one sentence. I kind of feel bad for him in that what he studies is so trivial.

His powerpoints are like 5 slides long- for a 2hr class  (meaning he puts way too much info on each slide, making it harder to understand it all). Also, the ppts are just a bunch of facts with no relationship to each other- hard to learn the material if you don't already know it. Very VERY bad at speaking in front of a class and teaching in general
I thought this class would be great and I would learn a lot, but he is such a terrible speaker I completely lost interest in all the material.

This class will seem all over the place at the beginning but just stick with it. All quiz material is on the powerpoints, He gives study guides for the tests, summaries are not too bad. I got a B and C on the tests and still got an A.

This class will seem a bit all over the place at the beginning but just bear with it and go to class. All material on quizzes is in the powerpoints, he gives study guides, writing assignments are a bit confusing however. I got a B and C on the two tests but still managed an A in the class.
